uncertainty_note: Metadata of videos/photos could not be extracted, preventing geolocation. Unclear if interaction transpired in Greek or Turkish territorial waters. Migrants filmed in life rafts could suggest end phase of expulsion, possibly in TTW. Conflicting reports on initial location.
context_note: NGO reported alleged collective expulsion by Hellenic Coast Guard (HCG) near Chios, Greece, involving a Frontex vessel (Italian Guardia di Finanza) and alleged breaking of a migrant's arm during a body search. Migrants were reportedly abandoned in life rafts and rescued by Turkish Coast Guard (TCG). Frontex Fundamental Rights Office (FRO) found no Frontex vessels deployed, could not confirm initial location in Greek territorial waters, nor definitively link media to the incident. Conflicting reports on incident location (Greek vs. Turkish waters) and number of migrants (35, 24, 60). FRO notes modus operandi resembles previous HCG practices but lacks conclusive evidence for this specific case. Greek authorities denied allegations and provided insufficient information.
evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office finds it possible that a collective expulsion may have occurred, but the circumstances of the incident remain unclear due to a lack of conclusive evidence.

location_details: Tripoli, Tripoli, Libya; 40 nautical miles North East of Tripoli(Libya)
where_clear: 40 nautical miles North East of Tripoli, Libya (Central Mediterranean Sea)
location_text_raw: Tripoli, Tripoli, Libya; 32.895278; 13.181111; 40 nautical miles North East of Tripoli(Libya)
context_note: On 21st April, a grey rubber boat with about 80 persons on board was sighted adrift 40 nautical miles North East of Tripoli, Libya. FSA informed MRCC Rome, Malta, Tunis, and Libya. Due to deteriorating weather, distress communications were broadcasted. Libyan Coast Guard requested Italian MRCC to divert ships. Merchant vessels "ALK", "LISBETH", and "MY ROSE" proceeded to assist. On 22nd April, an empty, partially deflated rubber boat was spotted approximately 51 nautical miles North of Tripoli. A floating body was sighted. NGO vessel "OCEAN VIKING" and merchant vessel "MY ROSE" were also in the area. "MY ROSE" communicated finding three additional bodies, bringing their total to eight. Media outlets reported up to 120 migrants might have died. Frontex surveillance aircraft performed three flights on 21-22 April. The shipwreck likely occurred between the return of the Frontex aircraft on 21.04 and the arrival of merchant vessels. Italian authorities confirmed that under Libyan Rescue Center coordination, three merchant ships assisted, and a Libyan patrol boat rescued 104 people from one of two boats.
evidence_quote: FSA Sighting in Central Med capsize of a rubber boat, 4 bodies found... Merchant vessel "MY ROSE" spotted eight bodies in the area... Several media outlets reported that 120 migrants might have died in a shipwreck off Libya.

location_details: Migrant killed by train in Tychero, Evros, Greece.
context_note: On 05-06-2020 at 09.30 hrs one (01) migrant (male) was hit and killed by train running from Alexandroupolis to Ormenio. The driver of the train stopped immediately and informed Hellenic Police after he realized the incident. It is supposed after the investigation that the migrant was probably sleeping on the railways and was killed immediately. An ID card was found in his possession issued by AFG authorities. According to ID the migrant was 25. The corpse of the dead person was transported to Alexandroupolis' Hospital. Forensic surgeon of Alexandroupolis' Hospital was requested to conduct the autopsy. No criminal activity was recognized.
evidence_quote: one (01) migrant (male) was hit and killed by train running from Alexandroupolis to Ormenio.

location_details: Dead body found in river Evros, close to the Greek bank, in the area of Petrades, Didymoteicho, Evros, Greece.
context_note: On 15-06-2020 at 12:00, one (1) male dead body has been found in river Evros, close to the Greek bank, in the area of Petrades. The dead body was transferred to Alexandroupolis' Hospital. The autopsy was requested by Hellenic Police in order to identify the reason of death. Preliminary investigation is still ongoing by the Security Department of Didymoteicho. The dead body was possibly a migrant from Morocco, who tried to cross the river. 29/07/2020: According to a doctor after an autopsy it is estimated that this man was between 25 and 35 years old and he was drawn in the water, inside a timeframe of three months before the day that he was found. One credit card was found on him. An Arabic name was written on it and the card was from a bank from Morocco.
evidence_quote: one (1) male dead body has been found in river Evros, close to the Greek bank, in the area of Petrades

location_details: Four migrants were intercepted by Lithuanian border guards and Frontex Standing Corps Officers after crossing the border from Belarus into Lithuanian territory, near a Frontier Station. They were subsequently removed from Lithuanian territory and sent back to Belarus.
context_note: On 9 April 2022, four migrants were intercepted by Lithuanian border guards and Frontex Standing Corps Officers after crossing the border from Belarus into Lithuanian territory. Despite having been granted interim measures by the European Court of Human Rights, the migrants were removed from Lithuanian territory and sent back to Belarus. They were later detained again in Lithuania on April 13, 2022, and allowed to apply for asylum.
evidence_quote: On 09 April 2022, four migrants of personal data nationalities were removed from the Lithuanian territory and sent back to Belarus by Lithuanian border guards in application of para. 2 and 3 of Decision No. 10V-20 despite having been granted interim measures by the European Court of Human Rights.

context_note: A Moroccan migrant was apprehended at a bus station near the Lithuanian-Belarusian border by a joint patrol including Frontex officers. The migrant, who was observed limping, was subsequently directed back to Belarus. This action raised concerns about possible violations of the right to asylum, non-refoulement, and prohibition of inhuman and degrading treatment.
evidence_quote: On 11 April 2022, a joint patrol composed of a Lithuanian border guard and two Frontex officers were asked to assist in the search for an unknown person... The person was found, apprehended... and identified as a migrant... he was directed from the territory of Lithuania back to Belarus.

location_details: Migrants claimed to have been apprehended by Albanian authorities on 02/04/2022 after crossing the Greek-Albanian border on 01/04/2022. They were transported to a centre, then on 03/04/2022 brought in a police car to an abandoned area 40-50 minutes driving distance from the detention centre, dropped off on a path to the Greek-Albanian border, and coerced to cross into Greece. They were rescued by Greek authorities on 04/04/2022.
context_note: Migrants claimed to have been apprehended by Albanian authorities, transported to a centre, then brought to the Greek-Albanian border and coerced to cross into Greece. The Fundamental Rights Office could not assess the veracity of these allegations but noted consistency with similar accounts in other SIRs. The report recommends continued monitoring of such allegations and ensuring access for Fundamental Rights Monitors.
evidence_quote: Albanian authorities allegedly brought them in a police car to an abandoned area, 40-50 minutes driving distance from the detention centre. They were dropped off on a path to the Greek-Albanian border and, wielding batons, Albanian reportedly authorities coerced them to cross the border to Greece.

location_details: A group of 5 migrants crossed illegally the border from Belarus to Lithuania and were later returned to Belarus by Lithuanian Border Guards as part of a seven persons group.
context_note: On 08 April 2022, five migrants crossed illegally the border from Belarus to Lithuania. They were later returned to Belarus by Lithuanian Border Guards as part of a seven persons group in application of Decision No. 42 of 2 August 2021. The Fundamental Rights Office found that the Lithuanian State Border Guard did not conduct individual vulnerability assessments before returning the migrants, potentially leading to serious breaches of fundamental rights.
evidence_quote: a group of 5 migrants crossed illegally the border from Belarus to Lithuania were [REDACTED] by Frontex SCO. The five migrants were then redirected to Belarus by Lithuanian border guards as part of a seven persons group in application of Decision No. 42 of 2 August 2021.

context_note: A serious incident occurred in the Evros region, Greece, on April 16, 2022. According to local media, Turkish military helped traffickers smuggle migrants into Greece. When boats approached the Greek shore, Text removed - Reporting Tools turned on powerful lenses. Turkish army/police fired at the boats to prevent return, killing one woman and injuring others. The incident is under investigation.
evidence_quote: According to local media there was a serious incident in Text removed - Operational Area in which a woman irregular migrant lost her life. Specifically, Turkish military were helping traffickers to smuggle illegal immigrants into Greece in two boats. But when the boats started approaching to the Greek shore, there was an ambush of Text removed - Reporting Tools in the area, who, as is their custom in these cases, turned on powerful lenses to prevent the irregular migrants from reaching Greek shore. Seeing this situation, the Turkish army/police, in order not to allow the smugglers with the migrants to return back, fired at the boats. As a result, a woman was killed and there are also injured.

location_details: Two groups of 37 and 46 Syrian refugees, respectively, on islets in Evros, including infants, small children, and sick people, in very precarious conditions for many days.
context_note: GCR informs about two groups of 37 and 46 Syrian refugees on islets in the Evros River, including infants, small children, and sick people, in very precarious conditions for many days. The ECtHR has instructed the Greek Government not to remove them and to provide food, water, shelter, and medical care. GCR requests information on compliance, noting that the Integrated Border Management Center (KODISME) Orestiada has not yet located them.
evidence_quote: Σε συνέχεια των συνημμένων παρέμβασεών μας (...) για την υπαγωγή σε διαδικασία υποδοχής και ταυτοποίησης δύο ομάδων 37 και 46 Σύρων προσφύγων, αντίστοιχα, σε νησίδες στον Έβρο, σας ενημερώνουμε ότι το Ευρωπαϊκό Δικαστήριο για τα Δικαιώματα του Ανθρώπου υποδεικνύει στην Ελληνική Κυβέρνηση τη μη απομάκρυνσή τους από τη χώρα και την παροχή σε αυτούς τροφής, νερού, προσωρινής διαμονής και κατάλληλης ιατρικής φροντίδας (οράτε συνημμένες αποφάσεις του ΕΔΔΑ).

Traumatized children are present. The group is asking for asylum and urgent help. Greek authorities were informed, but an officer was reportedly unaware of the distress.
evidence_quote: Concerning the stranded group of 37 refugees in Evros river, the situation at 03:23 CET is as follows: ... One woman is reportedly in severe medical condition and needs immediate medical help. ... There are reportedly traumatised children among them who have been trapped for long time exposed to the bad weather. ... They are reportedly in need of protection and asked for asylum. ... One woman of the group would need Dialysis according to the people and she allegedly did not have Dialysis for 8 days now.

evidence_quote: Κατόπιν επικοινωνίας μας προ ολίγων λεπτών με την ομάδα των 46 Σύρων προσφύγων που βρίσκονται ακόμη στη νησίδα, για τους οποίους έχει εκδοθεί η συνημμένη απόφαση του ΕΔΔΑ, η οποία σας έχει ήδη σταλεί από χθες, σας ενημερώνουμε ότι, όπως μας μεταφέρουν οι ίδιοι, η στάθμη του νερού ανεβαίνει και κινδυνεύουν. Με βάση τα στοιχεία που μας έχουν στείλει ως προς την τοποθεσία τους και είναι στην κατοχή σας η νησίδα εμφαίνεται στον χάρτη στην συμβολή του παραπόταμου ΕΡΥΘΡΟΠΟΤΑΜΟΣ και του Έβρου.

The National Committee for Fundamental Rights and the Greek Council for Refugees have sent letters from the ECtHR concerning this and other groups (37 people). The report asks for feedback on handling these cases.
evidence_quote: Presence of 46 Syrian refugees on an islet within the Evros river, without the necessary supplies, for a period which may exceed five days.

context_note: On 17.04.2024, during a weapon handover, a SC Officer noticed a discrepancy in the number of bullets. The SC Officer involved in the handover has since left the operational area. The incident is considered a breach of Frontex CoC.

location_details: This SIR covers two incidents reported by a migrant. The first incident on 24/03/2024 involved 16 migrants departing Bodrum, Türkiye towards Kos Island, intercepted by a Greek vessel, forced to board, beaten, belongings confiscated, returned to their rubber boat, towed, damaged, left adrift at sea in Turkish territorial waters, and eventually rescued by the Turkish Coast Guard. The second incident on 07/04/2024 involved 70 migrants departing Bodrum, Türkiye towards Leros Island on a sailboat, stopped near Leros Island by a Hellenic Coast Guard boat, forced to board a larger HCG vessel, beaten, belongings confiscated, transferred to three life rafts, abandoned at sea, and rescued by the Turkish Coast Guard.
where_clear: Aegean Sea, between Bodrum (Türkiye) and Greek islands of Kos and Leros.
location_text_raw: Bodrum, Türkiye, Kos Island, Leros Island, Greek territorial waters, Turkish territorial waters, Aegean Sea.
geocodable_query: Aegean Sea between Bodrum, Turkey and Kos and Leros Islands, Greece
uncertainty_note: Exact interception locations for both incidents are not confirmed, but within the general sea area between Turkey and the specified Greek islands.
context_note: This Final Report from the Fundamental Rights Office details two alleged pushback incidents involving the Hellenic Coast Guard in the Aegean Sea, based on a migrant's account. The Office considers the migrant's account credible and finds it likely that collective expulsions occurred in both cases, and that migrants were abandoned at sea, posing a threat to life. Allegations of ill-treatment could not be independently verified. The Greek authorities denied wrongdoing and provided insufficient information.
evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office considers the migrant's account detailed and credible, and finds it likely that collective expulsions occurred in both incidents, with migrants abandoned at sea by the Hellenic Coast Guard.

location_details: A group of 16 migrants left Bodrum, Türkiye, towards Kos Island, Greece, in a rigid hull inflatable boat. The boat was intercepted by a Greek vessel and later by a Hellenic Coast Guard (HCG) vessel. Migrants were forced to board the HCG vessel, beaten, and had personal belongings confiscated. They were then transferred back to their rubber boat, towed for about 30 minutes, and left adrift at sea after the HCG crew damaged the boat. Eventually, they were rescued by a Turkish Coast Guard vessel.
where_clear: Sea area between Bodrum, Türkiye and Kos Island, Greece
location_text_raw: Bodrum, Türkiye in the direction of Kos Island
geocodable_query: Aegean Sea between Bodrum, Turkey and Kos Island, Greece
context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office notes the incorrect reporting by the Greek authorities of the incident as [REDACTED] which fails to take into account that the migrants were not merely sighted but brought to Turkish territorial waters.
evidence_quote: Regarding the migrant's attempt to reach Kos on 24/03/2024, the Fundamental Rights Office cannot confirm with certainty but considers likely that the group of 16 migrants was subjected to collective expulsion from Kos to Turkish territorial waters where they were abandoned at sea by the Hellenic Coast Guard.

Both CIV migrants were immediately transferred to Mytilene hospital and later at Text removed - Reporting Tools the doctors announced that younger CIV migrant died.

location_details: Five migrants were detected by Frontex staff in Bulgaria, close to the Serbian border. They alleged being apprehended in Serbia, having their belongings taken/destroyed, and being forced back to Bulgaria.
where_clear: Near the Serbian-Bulgarian border, on the Bulgarian side.
uncertainty_note: Specific location details are redacted, but the general area of the Serbian-Bulgarian border is consistently mentioned.
context_note: Frontex operational staff in Bulgaria detected five migrants near the Serbian border. The migrants, including three alleged minors, claimed Serbian border police destroyed their documents, took valuables, and forced them back to Bulgaria. They were exhausted, and one had no shoes. The Fundamental Rights Office could not independently corroborate the allegations but found it plausible that the incident occurred as described.
evidence_quote: The migrants alleged that Serbian border police officers destroyed their documents, took all their valuables, and forced them to cross back to Bulgaria earlier the same day. The migrants were exhausted, one of them had no shoes on.

location_details: A Frontex team detected five migrants close to the Serbian border in Bulgaria during regular patrol activities on 07/04/2024. The migrants alleged that Serbian border police officers destroyed their documents, took their valuables, and forced them to cross back to Bulgaria earlier the same day. The migrants were exhausted, and one had no shoes.
uncertainty_note: Specific location on the border is redacted.
context_note: The Office regrets the lack of detailed response by the Serbian authorities and highlights the importance of thorough national investigations into all such allegations.
evidence_quote: Against this backdrop, the Office finds it possible that a group of five migrants was apprehended in Serbia by the Serbian authorities, had their personal belongings taken or destroyed, and was subsequently forced to cross the border to Bulgaria.

location_details: The incident involved a migrant boat in the North Aegean Sea, initially detected near Lesvos island in Greek territorial waters. It was intercepted by a Frontex vessel and subsequently handed over to the Hellenic Coast Guard near the maritime border between Türkiye and Greece. The boat eventually proceeded towards Turkish territorial waters where migrants were collected by the Turkish Coast Guard near Çanakkale's Ayvacık district.
where_clear: North Aegean Sea, near Lesvos island and Çanakkale's Ayvacık district, close to the Türkiye-Greece maritime border.
geocodable_query: North Aegean Sea near Lesvos island, Greece and Çanakkale Ayvacık, Turkey
context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office investigated SIR 11695/2023 concerning a migrant boat incident in the North Aegean Sea near Lesvos. A Frontex vessel intercepted a migrant boat in Greek territorial waters, which then proceeded towards Turkish waters where the Turkish Coast Guard apprehended the migrants. The FRO disproved migrant allegations of ill-treatment, engine damage, towing, and threats by Frontex and HCG personnel. However, the FRO identified significant flaws in operational reporting by Frontex crews and Greek authorities, including instructions not to report the incident and incorrect reporting of the initial sighting location.
evidence_quote: SIR 11695/2023, containing this information, was launched on 29/04/2023.

location_details: A migrant boat attempting to reach Lesvos from Türkiye was stopped by a Frontex vessel in Greek territorial waters. The migrant's allegations of engine destruction, towing, and pushback were disproven. The boat turned back to Türkiye on its own and was later picked up by the Turkish Coast Guard from Turkish territorial waters.
where_clear: Greek territorial waters near Lesvos, Turkish territorial waters.
uncertainty_note: No specific coordinates provided.
context_note: The migrant's account of events proved to be untrue as regards the allegations against Frontex and overall unreliable. Available evidence has disproven allegations of towing, engine destruction, drawing of weapons, and of a pushback from Greece to Türkiye. The Fundamental Rights Office concludes that the fundamental rights of migrants have not been violated by Frontex or the Hellenic Coast Guard.
evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office concludes that the fundamental rights of migrants have not been violated by Frontex or the Hellenic Coast Guard.

location_details: A migrant boat attempting to reach Lesvos from Türkiye was allegedly stopped by a Frontex vessel in Greek territorial waters, North of Lesvos. The migrant later retracted initial claims, stating a Frontex crew threatened them, causing them to turn back to Türkiye. The boat was then handed over to a Greek vessel near the borderline between Greece and Türkiye, and migrants were picked up by the Turkish Coast Guard in Turkish territorial waters.
where_clear: North of Lesvos Island, in Greek and Turkish territorial waters
location_text_raw: Lesvos, Greek territorial waters, Turkish territorial waters, North of Lesvos
geocodable_query: North of Lesvos Island, Aegean Sea
uncertainty_note: Exact coordinates not provided, only general area.
context_note: A migrant alleged that a Frontex vessel stopped their boat in Greek territorial waters, destroyed its engine, and towed it to Turkish waters, leaving them adrift. Later, the migrant retracted parts of the allegations, stating a Frontex crew threatened them with a weapon, causing them to turn back, and then handed them over to a Greek vessel. The Fundamental Rights Office concluded that the migrant's account was unreliable and that no fundamental rights violations occurred, but noted reporting obligations were not fulfilled by Frontex officers.
evidence_quote: The migrant's account of events proved to be untrue as regards the allegations against Frontex and overall unreliable. Available evidence has disproven allegations of towing, engine destruction, drawing of weapons, and of a pushback from Greece to Türkiye. The Fundamental Rights Office concludes that the fundamental rights of migrants have not been violated by Frontex or the Hellenic Coast Guard.

location_details: Ten Nepalese migrants apprehended near the Greece-Albania border and subsequently held at the Qafë-Bôte Border Police Station / Temporary Reception Center in Albania.
where_clear: Qafë-Bôte Border Police Station / Temporary Reception Center, Albania
location_text_raw: near the Greece-Albania border, in the area under the jurisdiction of the BCU Qafë-Bôte.
context_note: On 15/04/2024, ten Nepalese migrants were apprehended near the Greece-Albania border and taken to Qafë-Bôte Border Police Station/Temporary Reception Center in Albania. During their detention until the morning of 16/04, no food or drinking water was provided by local authorities or other actors, despite migrants claiming to have been without food for up to 84 hours. Frontex staff provided some water and biscuits from their own stocks. The Fundamental Rights Office concluded that the lack of provision amounted to inhuman and degrading treatment and possibly put lives at risk, due to a recent change in the UNHCR/Caritas agreement for food assistance.
evidence_quote: the failure by the authorities to provide food to the migrants in this specific case amounts to inhuman and degrading treatment.

context_note: A fast boat with 14 POB was rescued by ESP/GC/OPV. Initially, 1 deceased and 3 injured were found. One of the injured persons later died in the hospital, bringing the total dead to 2 and injured to 2. The incident is under judiciary proceeding.
evidence_quote: fast boat rescued with 14 POB within them 2 injured and 2 corpse

context_note: An SC Officer, deployed to North Macedonia, traveled off-duty in a service rental car. The following day, the car's rear window was found broken, and a personal bag containing parts of his uniform was stolen from the trunk. The officer reported the incident late and with confusing statements to local authorities, leading to no penal procedure. All stolen uniform parts were later recovered by the officer.

context_note: Along with other Frontex members, Text Removed - Justification 2 was riding a rented scooter to view the Text Removed - Justification 4 emergency port. In a sharp road turn, the scooter ran over some loose stones, causing it to slip and overturned. In the accident, he injured his left arm, his legs and his big toe. Worst injury was his arm that received an open wound. The injured Frontex member were taken by other Frontex members to the local doctor/infirmary Text Removed - Justification 4, where his wounds were cleaned and the wound on his arm sewed with 20-22 stitches. Text Removed Justification 3. It is expected that the injuries will not cause long-term or lasting damage Text Removed - Justification 2. Text Removed Justification 3, 6. Text Removed - Justification 3, 5. The vehicle sustained only minor material damage. The compensation for this has been clarified with the owner of the scooter.

location_details: A forest in Bulgaria near the Turkey-Bulgaria border, within the JO Terra 2022 operational area. Bodies were later found and taken to a hospital in Burgas.

context_note: A group of 10 migrants (8 men, 2 women) crossed from Turkey to Bulgaria. Two migrants died during a two-day wait in a forest refuge due to cold and exhaustion after being told by Bulgarian authorities to wait. The group was later apprehended and 'pushed back' to Turkey. Bulgarian authorities retrieved the bodies but denied other allegations. FRO could not corroborate the allegations but noted consistency with other reports and expressed concern about the lack of response from Bulgarian authorities.
evidence_quote: A group of 10 migrants was arrested [redacted] in a forest in Bulgaria after crossing irregularly the Turkey-Bulgaria border on [redacted]. During the two-day wait, due to cold weather and exhaustion, two migrants [redacted] died.

location_details: A migrant was allegedly transferred from Montenegro to Albania, detained in Albanian territory, and then transported by Albanian police to the Albanian-Greek border, near Ktismata, Greece, where they were instructed to irregularly cross into Greece. The migrant was subsequently stopped by Greek authorities near Ktismata and transported to Delvinaki A, Greece. The migrant had previously been in a refugee camp in Ušivak, Bosnia and Herzegovina.

evidence_quote: SIR 11780/2022 alleges that the Albanian authorities transported a migrant to the border with Greece and instructed him to cross it. The veracity of this allegation could not be established.

location_details: A migrant was detected by Frontex and Serbian officers near the border with Bulgaria in Serbian territory. The migrant reported being beaten by three police officers in the forest after getting separated from a group, then found an abandoned building for the night, and apprehended the next morning on the road.

context_note: A migrant, who had crossed from Bulgaria, was found injured by Frontex and Serbian officers in Serbian territory near the border. The migrant reported being severely beaten by three police officers the previous day, resulting in visible bruises and swellings. The Fundamental Rights Office concluded that violence was used against the migrant, though unable to independently corroborate all details or the affiliation of the masked officers. Serbian authorities denied the allegations.
evidence_quote: The migrant was barefoot, wearing only a t-shirt and underwear, had visible bruises and swellings, had difficulties walking. According to his account shared with the Frontex officers, on 23/04/2024, he got separated from other six migrants and shortly after he was beaten by three police officers, who also took his clothes and shoes.

context_note: During a pre-departure body check for a return operation, an escort officer from an organizing Member State allegedly pressed a restrained returnee's neck with his boot. The action caused visible discomfort and ceased upon a Monitor's entry. No visible injuries were reported, but the Fundamental Rights Office concluded it was excessive force and a violation of fundamental rights, citing potential serious health risks including asphyxiation. The same escort was involved in a previous incident where he allegedly slapped a returnee.
evidence_quote: An escort officer from the organizing Member State allegedly pressed the returnee's neck with his boot, causing visible discomfort.

context_note: During a return operation, a Frontex Fundamental Rights Monitor (FROM) reported an OMS escort pressing his boot on a restrained returnee's neck, causing visible discomfort. The FROM assessed this as excessive force and a violation of fundamental rights. National authorities denied the incident and claimed standard procedures were followed. The Fundamental Rights Office concluded that excessive force was used and constituted a violation of fundamental rights. The same escort was allegedly involved in a previous incident of slapping a returnee.
evidence_quote: the Fundamental Rights Office concludes that excessive force was used on a returnee when an escort placed his boot on a restraint returnee during the pre-departure phase

context_note: A Danish helicopter detected a rubber boat with approx. 25 migrants in Greek territorial waters. The Hellenic Coast Guard took over, and subsequently, a Turkish patrol boat took responsibility for the incident in Turkish territorial waters. location_details: A rubber boat with approximately 25 migrants was detected by a Danish helicopter south of Chios in Greek territorial waters. The incident was later concluded on the Turkish side as a prevention of departure.

The assessment notes information indicating a possible location in Greek territorial waters within the JO Poseidon operational area, despite the reported conclusion on the Turkish side.
context_note: On 27.07.2020, a Danish helicopter detected a rubber boat with approximately 25 migrants south of Chios in Greek territorial waters. The Hellenic Coast Guard (HCG) arrived and took over, after which the Danish asset departed. JRCC Piraeus informed MRCC Ankara. According to Greek authorities, a Turkish patrol boat subsequently took responsibility for the incident in Turkish territorial waters, and ICC Piraeus registered it as a 'Prevention of Departure'. A Danish National Official (NO) reported a possible serious incident, questioning the reported location. Discussions in ICC Piraeus (JCB) referred to a misunderstanding, suggesting the request to change location was only for initial detection in Turkish TWs. Frontex is launching a SIR procedure due to information indicating a possible location in Greek territorial waters, despite the reported conclusion on the Turkish side as a prevention of departure.
evidence_quote: On 27.07.2020 at 06:21LT a Danish helicopter detected a rubber boat with approx. 25 migrants south of Chios in Greek territorial waters.

context_note: On 27.07.2020, a Danish helicopter detected a rubber boat with approximately 25 migrants south of Chios in Greek territorial waters. The Hellenic Coast Guard arrived, and the Danish asset departed. JRCC Piraeus informed MRCC Ankara. According to Greek authorities, a Turkish patrol boat took over the incident in Turkish territorial waters, and it was registered as a 'Prevention of Departure' by ICC Piraeus. A Danish National Official informed the FOC about a possible serious incident, and a SIR was later received from the Danish HELO by Frontex and Greek authorities. The incident was discussed in ICC Piraeus, where a misunderstanding regarding a request to change the reported location was noted. The Hellenic Coast Guard presented the event as a prevention of departure. Frontex is to launch a SIR procedure, as information indicates the migrant boat's possible location in Greek territorial waters within the JO Poseidon operational area, despite its reported conclusion on the Turkish side as a prevention of departure for unknown reasons.
evidence_quote: On 27.07.2020 at 06:21LT a Danish helicopter detected a rubber boat with approx. 25 migrants south of Chios in Greek territorial waters.

location_details: Lesvos, Lesvos, Greece; Greek territorial waters Lesvos; sea area Lesvos Island inside TTW
context_note: A migrant boat with approximately 30 people was sighted in Greek territorial waters near Lesvos and reportedly towed eastwards towards Turkish territorial waters by a Greek Coast Guard patrol vessel, with instructions not to monitor. Another rubber boat with approximately 60 migrants was detected in the sea area of Lesvos Island inside TTW, did not comply with HCG commands, and exited HTW, with two TCG patrol boats taking over. Turkish Coast Guard later rescued 60 migrants. Turkish media reported 74 migrants pushed back by Greek Coast Guard and rescued by Turkish Coast Guard near Ayvalık. Based on video footage, reconstruction of events, and inconsistent statements, it cannot be excluded that the incident involved an unprocessed return and a violation of the principle of non-refoulement.
evidence_quote: Based on the video footage, the reconstruction of the sequence of events based on the actual time and place, and the inconsistent statements provided in the verification process by the Hellenic Coast Guard, it cannot be excluded that the incident has the characteristics of a case of unprocessed return and violation of the principle of non-refoulement.

context_note: On 15 May 2024, a female [REDACTED] presented herself at Police station [REDACTED] claiming she is in relationship with above Frontex SC Officer with whom she periodically has arguments. According to her statement, on 15 May 2024, they had another argument resulting in her attacking above SC Officer. However, she did not have intention to sue him and, subsequently, no report was filed by the local Police. Above statement was made in the presence of the [REDACTED] who was asked to support MKD Police with translation. After being informed by [REDACTED] competent [REDACTED] contacted SC Officer in subject for the reason of welfare and clarification, who ensured that he did not wish any kind of support since it is a private issue. Moreover, he confirmed [REDACTED] to have recently moved to another apartment without having any further contact to his live-in partner. Since the female [REDACTED] could not find and present any identity document, she stated to the local authorities that her intention is to visit [REDACTED] Embassy in North Macedonia to support her issuing temporary travel documents to return to [REDACTED]. The case was not initially assessed as a SIR since it didn't meet the threshold of SOP on Serious Incident Reporting. According to further developments provided by [REDACTED] on 17 May 2024, a/m female reported at the Police Station of [REDACTED] a case of domestic violence against SC Officer in question deployed at [REDACTED] which resulted to body injuries and is against the penal law of North Macedonia. SC Officer [REDACTED] turned up to the Police Station of [REDACTED] after respective invitation by MKD Police, where he was interviewed by the HTC authorities. Afterwards, SC Officer in question left, claiming that his live-in partner did not press charges against him, which is obligatory for the criminal procedure to be initiated. To this end, [REDACTED] additionally informed [REDACTED] that the case will not be prosecuted ex officio by the Public Prosecutor and no further measures will be taken by the HTC authorities. [REDACTED] will request from [REDACTED] official documentation on the case filed. [REDACTED] reported immediately to the case [REDACTED] were informed and further instructed [REDACTED] in this regard [REDACTED] has been also notified respectively. [REDACTED] requested the official documents that have been drafted at Police Station of [REDACTED] related to the case, however [REDACTED] refused to provide them, demanding as an official request to be addressed from Frontex central level [REDACTED]. According to assessment by [REDACTED], the incident needs to be prossessed as SIR Cat. 2 Situations of potential violations of Code of Conduct (Articles 3 and 10). Considering the outcome of the investigation carried out by [REDACTED] Police Station, this kind of "bodily harm" for crimes prosecuted by private action, but considering the lack of the private notification towards the local Police, this event cannot be considered as a criminal case in accordance the applicable penal code in force. Since the official documentation, received from MKD police, doesn't provide any tangible evidence for the case, no further action from side of Sl-handler at this stage are expected, therefore I propose to close the SIR.
evidence_quote: JO North Macedonia: Reported case of domestic violence against SC Officer in question deployed at [REDACTED] which resulted to body injuries.

location_details: Incident occurred in the Alboran Sea, within the JO Indalo operational area, near Almeria, Spain. The boat was reportedly in the Moroccan SAR zone at the time of its disappearance.

context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office regrets not having received additional information from Spanish authorities to understand how a boat could have been lost in the Alboran Sea for seven days without detection by competent MRCC. While Frontex involvement was not found, it remains unclear if Spanish MRCC was informed of the boat's disappearance on May 7, 2022, and if deaths could be related to a delayed SAR operation, especially as the boat was reportedly in Moroccan SRR.
evidence_quote: On 14 May 2022, A Spanish Navy Vessel rescued three migrants on a boat [redacted] Almeria. The migrants reported to Spanish authorities that eight other people were initially on the boat with them but that they all died and were thrown at sea.

context_note: A Frontex surveillance aircraft (Eagle 1) spotted an overcrowded wooden boat with 20+ migrants in the Maltese Search and Rescue (SAR) area. RCC Malta instructed a commercial vessel (Ross Sea) to contact the boat. An NGO vessel (Sea-Eye 4) later rescued 24 migrants, alleging they had been at sea for days without water/food and were hypothermic. The Fundamental Rights Office (FRO) noted the significant time elapsed between the initial alert to Italian MRCC and the rescue, and regretted the lack of detailed information from Maltese authorities regarding their assessment and actions.

SOS messages kept arriving with the first (documented) Mayday likely to have reached RCC Malta at 0029 UTC.

context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office takes note of the statement by the Greek authorities according to which the migrant boat altered its course and proceeded to the Turkish Territorial Waters to avoid interception. Considering the sea-worthy nature of the migrant boat, its high speed and previous attempts to avoid interception as reported by the crew, the Fundamental Rights Office finds that a voluntary alteration of course to the Turkish Territorial Waters is possible. At the same time, the Fundamental Rights Office took good note of the statement of the crew according to which the HCG had performed dangerous manoeuvres upon arrival onsite putting at risk the migrants. The Office had enquired about specific measures taken with the Greek authorities but did not obtain any information in this regards.
evidence_quote: The reports of the Frontex deployed [redacted] and the HCG on the same incident raised questions as to what happened to a migrant boat with approx. 30 migrants.

The boat eventually altered its course towards Turkish Territorial Waters to avoid interception, which the FRO considers possible. However, concerns were raised and confirmed by FRO that the HCG performed dangerous and disproportionate manoeuvres, creating waves that significantly impacted the small migrant boat and potentially endangered the migrants.

The migrants later ended up in Turkish Territorial Waters (TTW) with the Greek authorities reporting that the boat had 'altered course towards TTW to avoid the interception'.

location_details: Incident occurred at Latitude 36.933333, Longitude 27.450000, inside Turkish Territorial Waters (TTW) near the maritime borderline. Detected by Land Observatory.
where_clear: Maritime borderline, inside Turkish Territorial Waters (TTW), Aegean Sea.
context_note: A rubber boat with approximately 25 migrants was detected by a Land Observatory inside Turkish Territorial Waters (TTW). HCG maritime assets attempted to intercept and immobilize the boat at the borderline using loudspeakers and police lights, but with negative results. Two TCG vessels were informed but did not respond. Migrants showed aggressive behavior towards Text Removed - Reporting Tools personnel, putting them in danger, leading to warning shots being fired at a safe area. A migrant jumped and attempted to assault Text Removed - Human Resources. The rubber boat was eventually immobilized at the border line, and TUR CG vessels initiated embarkation procedures under the supervision of HCG CPBs. The incident was assessed as having serious actual or potential negative implications on Frontex core tasks, with the migrant's aggressive behavior not matching the profile of persons seeking international protection, and the TUR CG's response being delayed and inactive. The final report proposed closure without additional actions, noting that personnel must always be prepared for aggressive behavior during boardings or interceptions.
evidence_quote: A rubber boat with approximately 25 migrants onboard was early detected by Land Observatory at the Text Removed - Operational Area inside TTW. ... warning shots were fired at a safe area. During the incident, a migrant jumped and managed to embark on Removed - Technical Equipment trying to assault Text Removed - Human Resources.

location_details: 94 refugees on an islet in the Evros river, Greece. GPS: 41.327861, 26.598361 (from https://goo.gl/maps/VUunCvaXpHtkaW4z5). The group includes minors, sick people, and a disabled man. Communication was lost on the morning of May 27, 2022. Relatives reported that masked, Greek-speaking and Arabic-speaking individuals violently attacked the refugees and pushed them back to Turkey. Refugees were subsequently arrested by Turkish authorities and threatened with pushback to Syria. ECtHR had issued interim measures ordering non-removal and provision of aid.
uncertainty_note: The provided Google Maps link resolves to the same coordinates as SIR 11349/2022, suggesting the location is identical or very close. The number of people has increased from 25 to 94.
context_note: 94 refugees (including vulnerable individuals) on an Evros river islet. ECtHR ordered non-removal and aid. Alleged violent pushback by masked individuals to Turkey, followed by arrest and threat of pushback to Syria by Turkish authorities.
evidence_quote: ΑΠΟΦΑΣΗ ΕΥΡΩΠΑΪΚΟΥ ΔΙΚΑΣΤΗΡΙΟΥ/ ΑΣΦΑΛΙΣΤΙΚΑ ΜΕΤΡΑ ΓΙΑ ΤΟΥΣ ΑΠΟΚΛΕΙΣΜΕΝΟΥΣ 94 ΠΡΟΣΦΥΓΕΣ ΣΤΗ ΝΗΣΙΔΑ ΤΟΥ ΕΒΡΟΥ. ... Με τους προσφεύγοντες στο ΕΕΔΑ χάσαμε την επικοινωνία το βράδυ, ξημερώματα της σημερινής ημέρας, 27.5.2022. ... ομάδες κουκουλοφόρων και αραβόφωνους επίσης συνεργάτες τους εισήλθαν στη νησίδα και αφού επιτέθηκαν βιαίως στους πρόσφυγες, τους επαναπροώθησαν στην Τουρκία.

context_note: A group of 94 Syrian people, including children, women, elderly, and one disabled person, were allegedly in danger on an islet in the Evros river. An ECtHR decision ordered their non-removal and provision of aid. Later, contact was lost, and it was reported that hooded men violently attacked and repatriated them to Turkey, where they were arrested and threatened with deportation. Greek authorities conducted searches with no results.

context_note: Allegations of misconduct (verbal bullying, disobeying instructions, segregation, creating a toxic environment) by a Frontex Human Resources individual towards colleagues in Text Removed - Operational Area, Italy. Investigations found insufficient grounds to launch a formal procedure for CoC violation, attributing issues to misunderstanding, lack of experience, and accommodation problems (lack of privacy, common dinners/parties). Recommendations included training, reconsidering accommodation, and redeployment.

location_details: According to an NGO report, on 23/05/2024, a group of 25 migrants was in Greek territorial waters, six kilometers from the north-western shore of Samos, northwest of Karlovasi. A potentially matching incident was detected by HCG CPB 604 at the sea area North East of Samos island, inside TTW in position: 37°57'18"N, 027°00'00"E. The Turkish Coast Guard later rescued 18 irregular migrants (along with 7 children) off the coast of İzmir's Menderes district, stating they were in a lifeboat "that was pushed back into Turkish territorial waters by Greek assets".
where_clear: Greek territorial waters, near Samos island, northwest of Karlovasi, at approximately 37.955 N, 27.000 E.
location_text_raw: Greek territorial waters, six kilometers from the north-western shore of Samos, northwest of Karlovasi; sea area North East of Samos island, inside TTW in position: 3757'18"N, 02700'00"E; off the coast of İzmir's Menderes district.
uncertainty_note: The Office finds the exact location of HCG CPB 604's encounter with the migrant boat unclear. While the Fundamental Rights Office could not verify the timeline of events, it considers it likely that the migrant group was subject to collective expulsion, and by being abandoned adrift at sea in a life raft, the Office considers it likely that their lives were at risk. It remains unclear whether the migrant boat was still in this position when the videos showing the encounter between the migrant boat and the coast guard vessel were recorded.
context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office established that videos from migrants and pictures from the Turkish Coast Guard relate to the same group of 25 migrants. The HCG CPB 604 vessel is identified as involved. The Office considers it likely that the migrant group was subject to collective expulsion and their lives were at risk by being abandoned adrift at sea in a life raft. Allegations of holding migrants at gunpoint, searching them, and taking belongings could not be verified, but the modus operandi is consistent with HCG practices. The Greek authorities' reporting of the incident is considered incorrect as it omitted key facts, and their response to the FRO's enquiry was deemed insufficient.
evidence_quote: According to an NGO report, on 23/05/2024, a group of 25 migrants was in Greek territorial waters, six kilometers from the north-western shore of Samos, northwest of Karlovasi, when a Hellenic Coast Guard vessel approached their boat.

uncertainty_note: The location is given by coordinates, context implies N Macedonian-Greek border.
context_note: A Facebook post in a private group by a user (Text Removed - Human Resources) mentioned migrants in distress near the N Macedonian-Greek border, asking if any officers were deployed. The post included coordinates and details about two migrants in poor condition (one unconscious). The publication was later removed. It was questioned as a potential breach of Frontex's Code of Conduct, Art. 9.
evidence_quote: Sensitive information on migrants, precise location, request for persons deployed in the area, potentially related to Frontex activity and disclosed on social media. It is questionned whether this is a potential breach to the CoC, in particular Art.9.

The recipient immediately informed local police and visited the incorrect address, but the residents denied receiving any delivery. Efforts to track the shipment with TNT were ongoing, including visiting the TNT warehouse (which was closed on weekends). The equipment is described as double-use (civilian and military) and of considerable value.

uncertainty_note: The Fundamental Rights office acknowledges challenges related to the coordination of search and rescue in the location under scrutiny due to overlapping zones of state responsibilities
context_note: On 25/05/2022, Frontex Surveillance Aircraft team leaders (FSA TLs) diverted Heron 1 to an alleged shipwreck inside the Maltese SRR - Tunisian Territorial Waters based on information received from the Italian expert in EMT. Throughout the correspondence of the case, Maltese MRCC made clear that it had no duty to coordinate given the position inside the Tunisian Territorial Water with the Maltese Liaison Officer further insisting that a deployment of Heron 1 to the location would constitute a breach of the [redacted]. On-site, Heron 1 found the migrants in life rafts next to two NGO sailing boats but was soon asked to clear the area by Maltese Air Traffic Control (ATC) and the Maltese Armed Forces. Osprey 2 later returned to the location finding a Tunisian patrol vessel and the NGOs collaborating in rescuing the migrants eight (8) hours after Frontex had been alerted to the boat in distress and eleven (11) hours or more after Malta received a respective alert.
evidence_quote: Maltese MRCC made clear that it had no duty to coordinate given the position inside the Tunisian Territorial Water with the Maltese Liaison Officer further insisting that a deployment of Heron 1 to the location would constitute a breach of the [redacted].

location_details: Incident occurred at the barbed wire barrier from Belarus to Lithuania, within the Lithuania Operational area. On 29.05.2022, seven migrants were recorded crossing, and Lithuanian authorities confirmed ten irregular migrants crossed, applying preventive measures (redirection) on 29.05.2022 for five persons and on 30.05.2022 for another five persons.
location_text_raw: barbed wire barrier from Belarus to Lithuania
context_note: On 29.05.2022, ten irregular migrants crossed the barbed wire barrier from Belarus into Lithuania. Lithuanian authorities applied 'preventive measures,' redirecting the migrants back to Belarus. The Fundamental Rights Office concluded that these measures, while in observation of national legislation, are incompatible with Lithuania's obligations under EU law and asylum policy, potentially amounting to serious breaches of fundamental rights and posing a risk to Frontex's reputation.
evidence_quote: On 29.05.2022 at [redacted], seven (7) migrants were recorded by [redacted] crossing the barbed wire barrier from Belarus to Lithuania. Lithuanian authorities confirmed that in fact ten (10) irregular migrants illegally crossed the border and were automatically redirected back to Belarus.

location_details: A group of twelve migrants was transported by Albanian police officers to a place near the land border between Albania and Greece, specifically in the area of Border Control Unit (BCU) Kapshtice, close to Trestenik. They were then escorted on a footpath leading to the border with Greece, approximately 200m away, and coerced to cross it.
where_clear: Near the land border between Albania and Greece, in the area of BCU Kapshtice, close to Trestenik.
location_text_raw: a place near the border between Albania and Greece, area of BCU Kapshtice, On the way from Trestenik to the border, a location 200m from border with Greece, footpath leading to the border with Greece approx. 200m away
geocodable_query: Kapshtice border crossing, Albania-Greece border, near Trestenik
context_note: Albanian authorities transported a group of twelve migrants to the border and escorted them on foot until they crossed the border to Greece, while threatening the use of force. The veracity of this action was established and confirmed by the Albanian authorities, which have subsequently investigated and taken disciplinary measures against the four implicated police officers. The Fundamental Rights Office notes the consistency of these confirmed allegations with accounts in other Serious Incident Reports and urges the Albanian authorities to address this practice.
evidence_quote: a group of twelve migrants has been transported to a place near the border between Albania and Greece by Albanian police officers. The group was then escorted on a footpath leading to the border with Greece and coerced to cross it.

location_details: _ampedusa
context_note: A wooden boat carrying approximately 62-63 migrants from Tunisia (Sidi Mansur area) sank near Lampedusa. Italian authorities rescued 46 persons and recovered 7 bodies (sub-Saharan women). 9 people are considered missing. SAR operations were conducted but yielded negative results. While initial assessments indicated potential Fundamental Rights violations, the final conclusion stated that no link between authorities' actions and the deaths/disappearances could be identified, and potential violations could not be identified.
evidence_quote: 7 people drowned and 9 people missing in shipwreck near Lampedusa

evidence_quote: a Turkish Military Boat approached to its position in fast speed, inside Greek territorial waters Text Removed - Operational Area next to the border line, being a danger to the safety of its navigation.

location_details: A group of migrants landed in Kos and was allegedly attacked and ill-treated by masked armed men. They were later transferred to Kos' reception and identification centre (RIC). Apprehended in a rocky area of the island of Kos.
context_note: On 07 May 2022, a group of migrants that had landed in Kos was allegedly attacked and ill-treated by masked armed men. The group was later transferred by the Greek Hellenic Coast Guard to Kos' reception and identification centre (RIC). The Fundamental Rights Office expresses serious concern at the numerous allegations of fundamental rights violations against migrants that follow similar patterns and lack of follow-up by the Greek authorities.
evidence_quote: On 07 May 2022, a group of migrants that had landed in Kos was allegedly the target of attacks and ill-treatment by a group of masked armed men.

location_details: On 1 July, a rubber boat with approximately 40 migrants onboard was detected by the Hellenic Coast Guard (HCG) at the sea area of Samos Island inside Turkish territorial waters. The Turkish Coast Guard (TCG) patrol boats tried to escort the boat towards Hellenic territorial waters. JRCC Piraeus informed MRCC Ankara three times, and eventually two TCG patrol boats took over responsibility. HCG maritime assets remained close to the border line inside Hellenic territorial waters.

The Turkish Coast Guard (TCG) attempted to escort the boat towards Hellenic territorial waters, putting migrants' lives at imminent risk. JRCC Piraeus repeatedly informed MRCC Ankara. FRO considers potential fundamental rights violations.

context_note: A boat with approximately 100 people was detected by Frontex assets in the Tunisian SRR. Due to being in Tunisian FIR, closer inspection was not possible. Later, Tunisian Red Crescent reported a shipwreck off Tunisia with at least 43 migrants drowned and 84 rescued. The boat had allegedly set off from Zuwara, Libya. Frontex concluded no potential violation of EU or international law related to fundamental rights and international protection obligations could be established.
evidence_quote: On 3 July afternoon, Tunisian Red Crescent informed the media about a shipwreck off Tunisia with at least 43 migrants drowned and another 84 rescued and transferred to port of Zarzis.

context_note: Frontex Surveillance Aircraft (FSA) detected a boat with approximately 100 people in the Tunisian SRR. The boat was later involved in a shipwreck off Tunisia, resulting in 43 alleged drownings. Frontex informed relevant authorities (Tunisian, Libyan, Maltese, Italian). The incident happened in Tunisian territorial waters. Frontex concluded it took all possible steps and was not responsible for the event.
evidence_quote: FSA sighting in Central Med - shipwreck off Tunisia, 43 migrants allegedly drowned

location_details: In the Libyan Search and Rescue Region (SRR), near an overcrowded wooden boat.
context_note: Frontex surveillance aircraft detected an overcrowded migrant boat and a Libyan Coast Guard (CG) vessel in proximity. The Libyan CG vessel dispatched a fast rigid inflatable boat (RIB) whose crew members pursued, boarded, and physically abused migrants, including the person steering the boat, and during onboarding onto the CG vessel. The Fundamental Rights Office considers excessive force was used and notes this is not an isolated case of ill-treatment by Libyan officers, indicating frequent non-compliance with international law during SAR operations and systematic ill-treatment in Libyan prisons.
evidence_quote: The recording also shows incidents of physical abuse against migrants by the crew of the Libyan CG vessel during onboarding.

During the apprehension, the [redacted] an instance of potential use of excessive force by the Albanian officer in form of a kick. In addition, other migrants apprehended by the same team few hours earlier had claimed that they had been apprehended in the same area on 11 June 2022 by the Albanian authorities who had subsequently escorted them to the border with Greece.

location_details: Multiple attempts to enter Poland at the Terespol-Brest Border Crossing Point on the Poland-Belarus border, including crossing the bridge over the Bug river.
where_clear: Terespol-Brest Border Crossing Point, Poland-Belarus border
location_text_raw: BCP Brest (border crossing point in Belarus, opposite of Terespol), bridge crossing the river Bug (and border between the two countries)
context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office (FRO) was informed by an NGO about a family of [redacted] nationals who were repeatedly denied access to asylum procedures at the Terespol-Brest Border Crossing Point on the Poland-Belarus border between May and June 2024. Despite multiple attempts and prior notifications to Polish authorities, the family's wish to apply for international protection was disregarded, and they were denied entry without individual assessment or written decisions. The FRO concluded that this likely constitutes violations of the right to asylum, prohibition of collective expulsion, prohibition of inhuman or degrading treatment, and the right to an effective remedy. The family eventually entered Poland on 26/06/2024.
evidence_quote: The migrants were denied access to the Polish territory and did not receive any written decision on the refusal of entry, nor were their passports stamped accordingly.

location_details: Incident occurred on the Kula - Vidiv road, Bulgaria, near the Border Control Unit (BCU), at coordinates 43 54.828 N 22 33.822 E.
location_text_raw: on the Kula - Vidiv road (in position 43 54.828 N 22 33.822 E)
context_note: A Frontex officer reported that on 02/06/2024 after the apprehension of five migrants in the area of the Border Control Unit (BCU), one of them alleged that he was bitten by a service dog of the Bulgarian patrol during apprehension. The Frontex officer described the injury as a severe dog bite on the migrant's left shoulder. The migrant was referred to a doctor, and a medical certificate confirmed an hematoma and wounds. However, the Bulgarian authorities denied the dog bite and stated no injuries from animal bites were found, though they confirmed the use of a service dog. The Fundamental Rights Office considers the migrant was injured but the cause of the injury is unclear, and cannot verify if excessive force was used.
evidence_quote: The Frontex officer described the injury as a dog bite on the migrant's left shoulder, resulting in injury and bleeding in this area, along with several other less serious injuries on the migrant's back and legs which were probably caused by the rocks and vegetation in the area.

location_details: Kotoka International Airport, Accra, Ghana
context_note: Upon the landing of the main charter in Accra, Ghana - the destination of the referenced NRO - before the aircraft doors were opened, one of the returnees attempted to strike several escort agents ('EO') with his fists. The assigned escort team, with the support of the back-up team, brought the returnee back under control. According to the forced-return monitoring officer, the returnee was not handcuffed at the time of being struck by the EO, but was still under the control exercised by the respective escorts.
evidence_quote: Potential Fundamental rights and Frontex CoC violation by host (organising MS) staff

location_details: Korçë, Albania
uncertainty_note: Latitude and Longitude are redacted.
context_note: An Albanian officer from [redacted] patrol, arrested a group of 3 irregular migrants claiming to be [redacted] citizens. The patrol was joined by a local pastor's son (apparently an 8-10 years old boy) who provided information about this arrest case and previous searches in that area of operations and offered help in identifying the location of the migrants. At [redacted] the Albanian officer from [redacted] approached the child's location and started talking to the child in Albanian. [redacted] could not understand anything of the content of the conversation. Suddenly and out of nowhere, the Albanian officer struck the boy with his right hand flat on his left cheek. After the first hit, [redacted] immediately ran to their location and saw that the Albanian officer used his left hand to hold the boy on his shirt while hitting him with his right hand flat again. [redacted] began yelling at him to stop as he reached their position. He dragged the Albanian officer away from the child, who started screaming and crying at the same time and eventually ran away.
evidence_quote: the Albanian officer struck the boy with his right hand flat on his left cheek.

The reporting person was able to provide details on some of the attempts such as the numbers of vessels used by the authorities to bring him out to sea after landing on Chios and Leros on two occasions.

context_note: A migrant reported multiple pushbacks by Greek authorities and masked men between 2020-2022 in the Samos, Chios, Leros, and Evros regions. The report details several incidents, including being forced onto vessels and returned to Turkey, handcuffing, and confiscation of money. The Fundamental Rights Office could not conclusively establish the facts but expressed concern over frequent allegations of collective expulsion and lack of thorough investigations by Greek authorities.
evidence_quote: A migrant orally reported to a Fundamental Rights Monitor multiple pushbacks by Greek authorities and masked men when attempting to reach Greece over a timespan from 2020-2022 in the Samos, Chios, Leros and Evros regions.

context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office (FRO) investigated an incident involving a migrant boat with 8-10 individuals in Hellenic Territorial Waters near Samos, which eventually ended up in Turkish Territorial Waters. The FRO noted inconsistencies between Frontex and HCG reports. Greek authorities stated migrants voluntarily moved to TTW to avoid interception, a claim the FRO could not cross-check. The FRO could not exclude the possibility of voluntary movement but also noted the boat was stationary at handover. Both Frontex and Greek border guards perceived the boat was not in distress, though the presence of vulnerable persons remains unclear. The FRO regrets not receiving a reply from Greek authorities regarding the specifics of their actions.
evidence_quote: Based on information by the Greek Land Observatory, intercepted, on 15/06/2022 at a boat with 8 migrants at the sea area island inside Hellenic Territorial Waters. A stationary migrant boat to the Hellenic Coast Guard. The migrants later ended up in Turkish Territorial Waters.

The boat was fully afloat and not in distress. The Hellenic Coast Guard (HCG) was called, took over the situation, and was observed moving the vessel towards the Turkish borderline. context_note: A Frontex patrol observed an inflatable rubber boat with at least 20 migrants (men, women, children) approximately 1 NM from the border, heading towards Chios Port. The boat was black, had no lights, was fully afloat and maneuverable, and not in distress. The Hellenic Coast Guard (HCG) was called and took over the situation. The Frontex vessel observed the HCG vessel moving towards the Turkish borderline with the migrant boat's echo, which then stopped moving at the borderline. No SAR operation was initiated, and no migrants arrived in Chios on that day.
evidence_quote: On the radarscreen we could follow the echo from the HCG Vessel, slowly moving towards the TUR borderline and not the other direction (to port). Therefore we followed the radarecho from their vessel. The echo stopped moving at the borderline.

context_note: Considering the involvement of the third country Libya, the Fundamental Rights Office has been unable to investigate the abuse of migrants during the rescue beyond the review of video evidence from Frontex surveillance aircraft. However, based on this evidence, the Fundamental Rights Office considers that excessive force has been used by the Libyan authorities during the described incident, violating rights of persons targeted to be free from inhuman and degrading treatment. Additionally, the Fundamental Rights Office is concerned about the safety of all rescued migrants upon disembarkation, considering the reporting by international NGOs about the detention conditions in Libya. In this respect, the Fundamental Rights Office invites dialogue on better coordination of SAR activities, including Frontex' classification of vessels requiring immediate rescue.
evidence_quote: Frontex surveillance aircraft monitored the interception of the boat and embarkation of migrants, during which it recorded instances of physical violence by the Libyan Coast Guard vessel's crew against the people from the migrant boat. Specifically, five persons were slapped and hit to the head as well as kicked, some repeatedly. The Libyan vessel with migrants onboard then returned to Libya.

context_note: A migrant boat with approx. 50 migrants was sighted in Tunisian and Libyan SAR zones. Libyan Coast Guard intercepted the boat, and physical violence was recorded during the rescue. Migrants were returned to Libya. FRO notes excessive force and concerns about disembarkation safety.
evidence_quote: On 02/06/2022, Frontex surveillance aircraft sighted in the Tunisian SAR zone an overcrowded migrant boat with approx. 50 migrants on board, headed north, into the Libyan SAR zone. Tunisian and Libyan MRCCs were notified. Three hours later, the boat was sighted in Libyan SAR zone, with Libyan coast guard boat conducting rescue of the migrants. Frontex aircraft monitored the interception of the boat and embarkation of migrants, during which it recorded instances of physical violence by the Libyan Coast Guard vessel's crew against the people from the migrant boat.

context_note: At 07:35z, [Text Removed - Technical Equipment]spotted an overcrowded rubber boat with about 90 migrants on board [Text Removed - Reporting Tools]. The boat with more than 100 people on board was still close to the Libyan shore (approx. 30 nm) when it was detected. It was taking water at the rear. At 07:49 [Text Removed - Technical Equipment] assessed that this event was a distress situation. Instructed [Text Removed - Technical Equipment] immediately send a call for immediate assistance on [Text Removed - Technical Equipment]. [Text Removed - Reporting Tools], the [Text Removed - Human Resources] decided to ask [Text Removed - Technical Equipment] to specifically contact and direct the NGO vessel to scene. The NGO vessel answered at 07:59z informed the aircraft that they were heading to the SAR area. The [Text Removed Technical Equipment] shadowed the rescue activity until a RHIB from the NGO Vessel approached the migrant rubber boat and distributed life vests to the migrants. At that time the boat was in quite good condition, the sea state was good and the people on board were calm. After duly informing the NGO vessel, [Text Removed - Technical Equipment] was instructed by [Text Removed - Human Resources] to attend two other migrant boats that had not been relocated and were also in a critical situation. At 09:35Z [Text Removed - Technical Equipment] sighted a rigid inflatable boat from Open Arms approaching the migrant boat and distributed some lifejackets. According to the information provided by NGO Vessel Open Arms [Text Removed - Reporting Tools], during the rescue operation the boat structure failed and all passengers fell into the water. Later in the afternoon, NGO OPEN ARMS informed [Text Removed - Reporting Tools] that casualties had been reported during the rescue. At least 5 people had drowned and several severe casualties had been reported. Over 100 persons have been rescued by the NGO vessel. The NGO declared that now they are not able to provide a definitive number of people rescued during this event, but they communicated this information: Approximately 100 to 150 persons were rescued (number to be confirmed); 7 women and 4 kids, 2 of them babies; 1 pregnant woman (7 months) in state of hypothermia; 2 people in critical situation (1 of them a baby); 5 dead bodies (drowned); 1 person recovered by PCR (in need of further medical assistance); Several persons in state of hypothermia. UPDATE: A total of 261 migrants had been rescued and 5 corpses had been recovered in 3 separate incidents by the NGO Vessel Open Arms. Italian and Maltese authorities performed 2 MEDEVAC: [Text Removed - Reporting Tools] [Text Removed - Reporting Tools]. Trapani port was assigned for NGO vessel OPEN ARMS as Port of Safety by the Italian authorities. 14 November 2020, all migrants on board NGO vessel "Open Arms" disembarked at Trapani port [Text Removed - Reporting Tools] where they will remain in quarantine.
evidence_quote:
Dead persons: 5
Injured persons: 3

They reported being held for a day without food/water, beaten, and left on the island without provisions. Turkish individuals on the riverbank allegedly opened fire when approached.

location_details: Lithuania, operational area X2, in a wooden area in vicinity of BCU [redacted]
where_clear: Wooden area in Lithuania near a redacted border crossing unit (BCU) in operational area X2.
location_text_raw: wooden area in vicinity of BCU [redacted]
uncertainty_note: Specific border crossing unit (BCU) is redacted, and 'operational area X2' is a general designation, making precise geocoding impossible.
context_note: On 29.06.2022, Frontex officers observed a migrant in a wooden area near a redacted border crossing unit in Lithuania. Lithuanian border guards apprehended the individual and subsequently redirected them to Belarus as a 'preventive measure' under national legislation. The Fundamental Rights Office concluded that this action, while aligned with national law, is incompatible with EU law and asylum policy, potentially constituting serious breaches of fundamental rights, including inhuman and degrading treatment, right to asylum, and non-refoulement, and poses a risk to Frontex's reputation. The FRO recommended that Frontex not participate in such activities and urged Lithuanian authorities to ensure effective access to asylum, define clear procedures for identifying vulnerable people, and conduct individual assessments to prevent refoulement.
evidence_quote: On 29.06.2022 at 08:35 LT, two Frontex officers identified a migrant running across the road in a wooden area in vicinity of BCU [redacted]. They informed Lithuanian border guards and following on from this, Lithuanian border guards apprehended the migrant. Lithuanian authorities later confirmed that preventive measures were applied, meaning that the migrant had been redirected from the territory of Lithuania back to Belarus.

The boat was carrying approximately 100 migrants on board and was overcrowded and partially deflated. Some migrants were in the water, hanging on the boat and debris were scattered around. Text Removed - Technical Equipment immediately broadcasted a mayday relay message, calling for assistance. In parallel, Text Removed - Reporting Tools informed the relevant authorities. Text Removed - Technical Equipment, had to leave the area and return to base due to fuel limitation. Finally, Libyan Coast Guard performed the rescue operation that finished at approximately 11:30Z. A total of 102 migrants were rescued and 2 corpses were recovered.

location_details: The incident occurred in the sea area northeast of Kos island, within Greek territorial waters, during an interception by the Hellenic Coast Guard. The migrants were later disembarked at Kos island.
where_clear: Sea area northeast of Kos island, Greece
location_text_raw: Greek waters; sea area NE of Kos island inside TTW.
geocodable_query: sea area NE of Kos island, Greece
context_note: On 20 November 2020 we had 36 migrants arriving from 3 different incidents. In one of the incidents several of the migrants from the same incident (boat) told us that upon entering Greek waters monday 9th of November they were met by Hellenic Coast Guard who sailed around them creating large waves making the boat rock from side to side. One of the Greek officers even took out a large pointy object and gesticulated with his hands for them to turn back to Turkey. The Hellenic Coast Guard stopped after approximately 40 minutes when the Turkish Coast Guard came sailing towards the Greeks and asked them to stop. After that the Hellenic Coast Guard escorted the boat to Kos where they were taken into custody. This information were told by several of the 31, primarily, african migrants on the boat. They, of course, feared for their lives. These are not documented incidents but merely the migrant's view of the incident. We have no video nor pictures, only their testimony. Information provided to the OT of JO Poseidon from Text Removed - Reporting Tools; Human Resource related to some allegations from migrants against the actions of the HCG during the interception of their boat on the 09.11.2020. The migrants in subject were rescued in below incident: 01 incoming flow incident occurred in Kos involving 30 (TBC) migrants and an arrest of 1(TBC) facilitator. On 9th November 2020 at 05:20 a rubber boat with thirty (30) migrants on board was detected by HCG CPB Text Removed - Technical Equipment and Text Removed - Technical Equipment at the sea area NE of Kos island inside TTW. After detection JRCC Piraeus informed MRCC Ankara and simultaneously a TUR CG vessel which was close to the boat of migrants was informed but did not respond to the incident at all. Afterwards the TUR CG vessel escorted the above mentioned rubber boat towards to the HTW, obstructing the actions of the HCG CPB and exposing the lives of the migrants in danger. Subsequently, the TUR CG vessel left the area and all migrants were safely disembarked to Kos island under the close monitoring of HCG CPB Text Removed - Technical Equipment. One (1) facilitator was arrested. Text Removed - Reporting Tools; Human Resource informed that the migrants mentioned the allegations during the screening. Currently Greek authorities are not aware of any complaint from the migrants and at this moment (21/11 10:50) they are not investigating the case.
evidence_quote: upon entering Greek waters monday 9th of November they were met by Hellenic Coast Guard who sailed around them creating large waves making the boat rock from side to side. One of the Greek officers even took out a large pointy object and gesticulated with his hands for them to turn back to Turkey. ... at the sea area NE of Kos island inside TTW.

where_clear: Sea area NE of Kos island, Dodecanese, Greece
context_note: On 20 November 2020, 36 migrants arrived from 3 incidents. In one incident on 9 November 2020, a rubber boat with thirty (30) migrants on board was detected by HCG CPB 150 at the sea area NE of Kos island inside TTW. Migrants alleged that the Hellenic Coast Guard (HCG) created large waves and gesticulated for them to turn back to Turkey. The HCG stopped after 40 minutes when the Turkish Coast Guard (TUR CG) arrived. The TUR CG then escorted the boat towards HTW, obstructing HCG actions and endangering migrants. Subsequently, the TUR CG left, and HCG escorted the boat to Kos where migrants were taken into custody. One facilitator was arrested. Migrants mentioned these allegations during screening. Greek authorities are not aware of any complaint and are not investigating the case as of 21/11.
evidence_quote: upon entering Greek waters monday 9th of November they were met by Hellenic Coast Guard who sailed around them creating large waves making the boat rock from side to side.

context_note: Report highlights inconsistencies between migrant statements and Greek authorities' reports regarding an incident on November 9th, 2020, involving a rubber boat with 30 migrants near Kos island. Migrants reported HCG harassment and pushback attempt, while Greek authorities described a confrontation between HCG and TCG in both Turkish and Greek waters, with TCG obstructing HCG and creating dangerous waves. All migrants were safely disembarked in Kos.

evidence_quote: A migrant claimed that he entered illegally the Albanian territory on 11 June 2022 with a group of migrants. According to his account, after hiding in the forest for four consecutive days, seven of them were apprehended by the Albanian Police on 15 June 2022 in the area of [redacted]. Reportedly, the migrants were not informed about asylum procedures. He also claimed they hadn't been registered or fingerprinted and that two days later, on 17 June 2022, they were allegedly forced to take the path leading to the Greek border by Albanian Police officers.

context_note: Incident reported: Since 10/05/2022, the Greek authorities have been made repeatedly aware by monitoring NGOs of the presence of a group of 17 migrants stranded on islets in Evros river. At least since 15/06/2022, the authorities have been aware of the alleged location of this group and additional 18 migrants on one of the islets. All 35 migrants have been protected by ECtHR interim measures and their health situation has been gradually deteriorating over time. On 15/06/2022, the group is alleged to have had a violent encounter with a group of military-clad Greek-speaking persons, prompting it to change location. Video evidence provided to the Fundamental Rights Office suggests that during the period 10/05-23/06/2022, the authorities have been in the vicinity of and at least on one occasion in contact with the migrants. Until 23/06/2022, these 35 [redacted]
evidence_quote: Delayed rescue of migrants stranded on islets in Evros river
