location_details: Multiple instances of alleged refusal of entry at border crossing points between Croatia and Bosnia and Herzegovina.
where_clear: Border crossing points between Croatia and Bosnia and Herzegovina
location_text_raw: at [redacted], BCP, other border police stations
uncertainty_note: Specific border crossing points are redacted in the document.
context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office investigated multiple instances of alleged refusal of entry for persons seeking asylum at border crossing points between Croatia and Bosnia and Herzegovina on 10/06/2024. This involved two separate groups of two citizens each, and a group of 17 citizens (four families including six minors). While some individuals voiced an intention to seek asylum, the Office could not independently corroborate that access to asylum procedures was denied, noting that the group of 17 eventually applied for international protection in Croatia on 11/06/2024 at different border police stations after being initially turned back due to long waiting times.
evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office received a report describing multiple instances of refusal entry of persons reportedly asking for asylum at [redacted] on 10/06/2024.

location_details: A migrant boat was detected in the Libyan Search and Rescue Region (SRR), 77 miles from Khoms, Libya. The incident involved NGO speedboats and the Libyan Coast Guard.
where_clear: 77 miles offshore Khoms, Libyan Search and Rescue Region
context_note: Frontex surveillance aircraft detected a migrant boat in the Libyan SRR and informed Libyan MRCC and Coast Guard. NGO speedboats were rescuing eleven people when the Libyan Coast Guard (LCG) performed dangerous manoeuvres and fired shots at close range. The Fundamental Rights Office considers this a frequent practice by Libyan authorities, posing risks to fundamental rights. This incident highlights the risks of sending alerts to the Libyan MRCC, leading to disembarkation in a country not considered a place of safety. Previous SIRs also document similar violent interceptions and ill-treatment by LCG.
evidence_quote: LCG began a series of dangerous manoeuvres and fired several shots at close range in direction of the speed boats.

location_details: Albanian territory, near the border with Greece (Kakavia BCU area), with migrants transported to a police station and later to Delvinaki, Greece.
where_clear: Albanian territory, near Kakavia BCU and Delvinaki, Greece
location_text_raw: border line between Albania and Greece, police station, Kakavia BCU, Delvinaki (Greece)
geocodable_query: Kakavia border crossing, Albania-Greece; Delvinaki, Greece
context_note: Migrants entered Albania, were apprehended by Albanian Police, registered/fingerprinted, but not informed about asylum. Allegedly forced to cross to Greece and later apprehended by Greek authorities and transported to Delvinaki. FRO notes consistency with other pushback allegations.
evidence_quote: A man claimed that he entered illegally the Albanian territory with a group of 12 migrants. According to his account, he was dropped off by smugglers near the border line between Albania and Greece on the evening of 17.06.2022 and 10 hours later he crossed into the Albanian territory. He said that after four (4) days of walking (namely on 21.06.2022), they had been apprehended by Albanian Police officers and brought to a police station. Allegedly, the migrants were registered and fingerprinted but they were not informed about asylum procedures. The migrant also stated that on 21.06.2022 at 23:00 the Albanian police officers had forced them to take the path leading to the Greek border and after walking for one (1) hour they had been apprehended by Greek law enforcement officers. Reportedly, on 22.06.2022 the whole group was transported to Delvinaki (Greece).

location_details: border line between Albania and Greece; police station; Greek border; Delvinaki (Greece); Kakavia BCU
location_text_raw: border line between Albania and Greece
context_note: While the Fundamental Rights Office was not able to conclusively establish the alleged facts raised in the present SIR, the Office notes with concern consistency of alleged facts with other similar allegations of pushback reported in a number of SIRs over the past months.
evidence_quote: Albanian police officers had forced them to take the path leading to the Greek border

location_details: A Collecting Return Operation (CRO) involving a main charter flight and a preceding flight. Incidents occurred during transport to the airport, before take-off at an airport, and during the in-flight phase. Specific locations (departure, destination, collection point) are redacted.
where_clear: During a return flight operation, involving multiple airports and in-flight incidents.
location_text_raw: main charter from [redacted] to [redacted] and a preceding flight departing from [redacted] bringing the returnees to the collection point in [redacted]. during their transport to the airport and before and during the first flight. Before take-off at [redacted] airport. waiting area at [redacted] airport.
uncertainty_note: Key locations (departure, destination, collection point, participating Member States) are redacted, making precise geographical identification impossible. The incident spans multiple phases of an air return operation.
context_note: A Collecting Return Operation (CRO) involving multiple flights and airports. Incidents include excessive use of force by escorts against one returnee (Returnee 1) during transport to the airport and in-flight, involving kicks and a chokehold while restrained, resulting in physical injuries (hyperemia, scratches, swelling, pain). Separately, a family reported physical and verbal abuse by police officers during transport to the airport, including forced sedatives on the woman. Another returnee (Returnee 2) raised concerns about access to medicine and an alleged asylum application, leading to the suspension of his return. The Fundamental Rights Office found the excessive force against Returnee 1 to be well-established and likely disproportionate, recommending investigation. For the family and Returnee 2's asylum claim, the FRO could not establish further details.
evidence_quote: the Fundamental Rights Office considers that the kicks and the hold similar to a chokehold likely did not meet the criteria of necessity and proportionality amounting to excessive use of force by the [redacted] escort.

location_details: Assumed location in accordance with the interview performed to the migrant. Precise location is unknown.
uncertainty_note: Assumed location in accordance with the interview performed to the migrant. Precise location is unknown.
context_note: On 16.12.2020 informed that during a debriefing interview performed in Crotone on 27.11.2020 (under JO Themis 2020) a migrant reported an alleged push back from Greece to Turkey occurred in August 2019. On 18.08.2019, the interviewed migrant departed from Edirne - Turkey, towards Greece. After irregularly crossing the Turkish-Greek border (Evros River) along with a group of approximately 80 people and 12 facilitators, he was allegedly discovered by Greek police officers and sent back to Turkey by using a motorboat across the river. The police officers reportedly used force against migrants and facilitators. Some people wearing a uniform with a German flag allegedly witnessed the scene. Later on the migrant was arrested by the Turkish authorities and taken to a detention centre, registered and notified to leave the country. Afterwards he took a bus and travelled to Istanbul. In September 2019, the interviewed migrant crossed once again the border and entered Greece. One year later he travelled to Italy and landed in Crotone. On 07.01.2021, the Hellenic authorities provided with the assessment of the case. On 18.08.2019 the Hellenic Police did not identify any recorded interceptions related to irregular entry of migrants. A Frontex team was patrolling the Greek-Turkish land border in the wider area of jurisdiction and reported no migrant detection incidents. The final assessment concluded that there was no evidence or proof that allegations from the incident are grounded and that the reported incident took place.
evidence_quote: On 18.08.2019, the interviewed migrant departed from Edirne - Turkey, towards Greece; After irregularly crossing the Turkish-Greek border (Evros River) along with a group of approximately 80 people and 12 facilitators, he was allegedly discovered by Greek police officers and sent back to Turkey by using a motorboat across the river; The police officers reportedly used force against migrants and facilitators;

location_details: A white fiberglass boat with over 30 migrants departed from Libya, was initially detected in the Libyan Search and Rescue Region (SRR), and subsequently located and rescued in the Maltese Search and Rescue Region (SRR) by a Libyan vessel. Instances of violence against migrants occurred onboard the Libyan vessel.
location_text_raw: inside the Libyan Search and Rescue Region (SRR), Maltese SRR, departed from Libya
uncertainty_note: Specific coordinates within the broad Search and Rescue Region are not provided.
context_note: Frontex unmanned aerial aircraft detected a migrant boat in the Libyan SRR, later updated its position in the Maltese SRR. A Libyan vessel performed the rescue, during which instances of violence against migrants by Libyan crew members were observed. The Fundamental Rights Office raised concerns about ill-treatment, the principle of non-refoulement, and the coordination with Libyan authorities, noting that Libya cannot be considered a safe port.
evidence_quote: Frontex surveillance aircraft observed the onboarding of the migrants for approximately 20 minutes and reported instances of violence against two (2) migrants by at least three (3) crew members of the Libyan vessel.

location_details: The incident occurred inside the Libyan Search and Rescue Region (SRR) and later the boat was updated to be in the Maltese SRR. The boat departed from Libya.
where_clear: Sea area within Libyan and Maltese Search and Rescue Regions
location_text_raw: inside the Libyan Search and Rescue Region (SRR) according to initial estimates. Frontex unmanned aerial aircraft updated the position of the boat in the Maltese SRR.
geocodable_query: Libyan Search and Rescue Region, Maltese Search and Rescue Region
uncertainty_note: The boat was initially reported in Libyan SRR, then updated to be in Maltese SRR, making the exact location within these broad areas uncertain.
context_note: Based on video footage, the Fundamental Rights Office (FRO) could not assess sea or boat conditions to determine if the migrant boat was in need of assistance. However, FRO concluded the boat departed from Libya, was in the Maltese SRR, and some migrants rescued by the Libyan vessel were victims of ill-treatment by crew members. FRO acknowledges Frontex's contribution to SAR but underlines the importance of balancing saving lives with the risk of interacting with third-country authorities with poor human rights records, which could lead to disembarkation in unsafe ports like Libya. FRO notes similar cases of abuse by the Libyan Coast Guard in previous SIRs and suggests that information sharing could be indirect involvement in refoulement practices, with legal and reputational risks. FRO expresses concern at instances of violence recorded by Frontex surveillance aircraft, confirming two migrants were ill-treated by at least three crew members onboard the Libyan vessel, which may violate human dignity and prohibition of inhuman/degrading treatment.
evidence_quote: Frontex surveillance aircraft observed the onboarding of the migrants for approximately 20 minutes and reported instances of violence against two (2) migrants by at least three (3) crew members of the Libyan vessel

location_details: The incident involved a migrant boat initially sighted by Frontex in the Libyan Search and Rescue Zone. A distress call was later reported from the Maltese Search and Rescue Region, with coordinates 34°34'24.08"N 16°21'34"E. The boat was subsequently intercepted by a vessel belonging to the Tareq Bin Zeyad armed group, reportedly inside the Maltese Search and Rescue Zone, against instructions from a Maltese Military aerial asset.
where_clear: Maltese Search and Rescue Zone, near 34.573356 N, 16.359444 E
location_text_raw: Libyan Search and Rescue Region, Maltese Search and Rescue Zone, position 34 34 24 08N 016 21 34E
context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office (FRO) investigated the interception of a migrant boat, initially sighted by Frontex, by the Tareq Bin Zeyad armed group. FRO identified 8 confirmed occasions where this militia intervened after Frontex sightings, including this event in the Maltese Search and Rescue Region, allegedly against instructions from Maltese authorities. FRO has consistently warned Frontex about human rights risks associated with interventions by Libyan actors, especially the Tareq Bin Zeyad group, known for severe fundamental rights violations. While Frontex is legally obliged to notify rescue coordination centers, FRO recommends strong safeguards to mitigate risks when sharing sightings, given the lack of human rights compliance by Libyan authorities and militias.
evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office determined that the migrant boat in question was sighted by Frontex in the Libyan Search and Rescue Zone and later intercepted by the Tareq Bin Zeyad vessel.

evidence_quote: It further notes that in a later incident (SIR 13079/2023), that equally looked into allegations of migrants being returned to Libya, the same vessel, Tareq Bin Zeyad, can be seen at the scene in the video footage of an NGO.

context_note: A Frontex staff member deployed in Almeria overheard 3 slaps from a waiting room where 7 migrants were present. Upon checking, one migrant was observed with a bloodshot eye, which was not present before processing. Two Spanish local police officers were also in the room. Migrants had recently arrived after being at sea. The Spanish Police authorities later stated that officers intervened because the migrant ignored COVID-19 safety measures and did not respect social distancing, claiming the migrant suffered no injury. This contradicts the initial observation of a bloodshot eye.
evidence_quote: Out of nowhere, we hear 3 slaps (like the open hand to face). Shortly after I pass by the room holding the arrivals and look at the seven men sitting there. One now has a bloodshot eye. None of the seven men had this whilst being processed.

Frontex staff and medical personnel did not observe visible injuries during screening on 05/07/2023. location_details: The incident occurred deep inside Greek territorial waters, less than [REDACTED] the coast of Symi, involving a migrant boat that was intercepted by Frontex and later handed over to the Hellenic Coast Guard. The boat subsequently altered course and ended up in Turkish territorial waters. The interception point was described as being near Symi island, inside HTW (Hellenic Territorial Waters), and all points of detection, interception, and handover were deep inside Greek territorial waters, less than [REDACTED] the Greek coastline.
where_clear: Near Symi island, Greek territorial waters, ending in Turkish territorial waters.
location_text_raw: deep inside the Greek territorial waters less than [REDACTED] the coast of Symi, Turkish territorial waters, Symi island inside HTW, TTW, deep inside Greek territorial waters, all points less than [REDACTED] the Greek coastline.
country_or_area: Greece, Turkey, Symi island, Aegean Sea
uncertainty_note: Specific coordinates or exact distance from Symi are redacted. The precise point of entry into Turkish waters is not specified.
context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office (FRO) investigated a possible pushback incident involving a migrant boat intercepted by Frontex in Greek territorial waters near Symi, which subsequently ended up in Turkish territorial waters after being handed over to the Hellenic Coast Guard (HCG). The FRO found discrepancies between Frontex's report of an 'interception' and HCG's report of 'detection'. Despite HCG's claim that the migrants voluntarily altered course, the FRO concluded that a voluntary return was unlikely given evidence of physical contact between vessels and the skipper's actions. The FRO cannot exclude that Frontex Standing Corps Officers were implicated in a pushback by Greek authorities, highlighting concerns about reporting clarity and potential violations of fundamental rights, including collective expulsion and inhuman treatment. Greek authorities provided standardized, unspecific responses to detailed questions, using identical phrasing across multiple SIRs.
evidence_quote: Frontex [...] intercepted a migrant boat deep inside the Greek territorial waters less than [...] the coast of Symi. [...] the migrant boat ended up in Turkish territorial waters. [...] the Fundamental Rights Office cannot exclude that Frontex Standing Corps Officers, by no fault of their own, were implicated in a so-called pushback by Greek authorities.

location_details: Evros river
context_note: Allegation of pushback from Greece to Turkey. On 4 August 2022, during a brief conversation with a migrant of [redacted] who had disembarked in Roccella Ionica stated that on two occasions, in July 2021 and April 2022, together with a group of three migrants, managed to illegally cross the border between Turkey and Greece by swimming in the Evros River. He claimed that in both cases they stayed in Greece for several hours hiding in a forest before being arrested. He further stated that they were then forced by police officers to return to Turkey by crossing the Evros River again. The Fundamental Rights Office is not able to comment on the veracity of the alleged facts, nor conclude whether fundamental rights of the migrants have been violated. The Fundamental Rights Office observes that allegations of involvement of Greek authorities in the irregular return of migrants to Turkey are frequent and have previously been reported in the framework of SIR. As regards the incidents alleged in this SIR 13372/2022, however, the Fundamental Rights Office could not corroborate the migrant's statements, owing to incomplete information provided at the time of interview in Rocella Ionica. The Greek authorities have likewise been unable to identify the alleged incidents for the same reason.
evidence_quote: Allegation of pushback from Greece to Turkey

location_details: Islet and bank in Evros river, Greek side of border
where_clear: Islet and bank in Evros river, Greek side of border, near Orestiada
location_text_raw: Islet and bank in Evros river, Greek side of border
context_note: 40 migrants stranded and pushed back in Evros region. The Fundamental Rights Office considers that the Hellenic authorities were, in fact, at times between 14/07 and 15/08/2022 aware of the whereabouts of the group of migrants but failed to reach them to provide assistance. In view of the Fundamental Rights Office, the authorities' failure to act to rescue the group over an extended period may have contributed to the death and injuries of some of the migrants. Regarding the allegations of violent pushbacks on 14/07, 26/07 and 01/08/2022, the Fundamental Rights Office considers the reports of pushbacks by migrants as relatively credible due to the detailed nature of the accounts, consistency of information reported from different sources, and correspondence with similar allegations reported in the past by various NGOs, IOs including the UNHCR, and raised in SIR procedures. The Fundamental Rights Office notes with serious concern that allegations of the involvement of Greek officers and unidentified other men (masked, Arabic and Kurdish speakers) accessing the migrants, despite the authorities' claims that the migrants could not be located, in order to violently push them back out of Greek territory, are numerous in Evros region. So are the reports of detention in the Greek territory without following proper registration procedures, and subsequent pushback. Such and other activities have been alleged, inter alia, in [redacted]. Against the backdrop of the overall credibility of migrants' accounts taken together, as well as other documentary evidence, the Fundamental Rights Office believes that the Greek authorities' blanket dismissal of all allegations raised in the framework of this SIR remains an important obstacle to a meaningful follow up in the form of effective investigations.
evidence_quote: 40 migrants stranded and pushed back in Evros region

location_details: The incident occurred at the sea area northeast of Rhodes Island, inside Turkish territorial waters, at coordinates 36°25'48.0"N 28°49'48.0"E. The Turkish Coast Guard later rescued migrants off the coast of Muğla's Fethiye district. Multiple positions were reported for the drifting motor yacht by the NGO and authorities, indicating a complex and disputed trajectory.
where_clear: Sea area northeast of Rhodes Island, Turkish territorial waters
location_text_raw: at the sea area northeast of Rhodes Island, inside Turkish territorial waters in position 36°25'48.0"N 28° 49'48.0"Ε.
uncertainty_note: Multiple coordinates provided for different stages of the incident (interception, drifting, rescue) and conflicting information on drifting direction. The NGO's reported drifting route from Turkish to Greek and back to Turkish waters is deemed unlikely by the FRO, contradicting wind direction.
context_note: A group of 64 migrants sailing from Türkiye to Rhodes was intercepted and irregularly returned to Turkish territorial waters by the Hellenic Coast Guard. The crew of a RHIB allegedly stopped the motor yacht, took belongings, destroyed the engine, and an OPV 080 reportedly towed it towards Turkish territorial waters. The FRO considers HCG involvement likely but cannot independently corroborate all alleged facts.
evidence_quote: In conclusion, the Fundamental Rights Office considers it likely that the Hellenic Coast Guard was involved in the incident but could not independently corroborate facts as alleged in relation of interception, towing of the motor yacht and subsequent irregular return to Turkish territorial waters.

location_details: The incident was reported to occur northeast of Rhodes Island, inside Turkish territorial waters, with specific coordinates provided for detection and rescue points. The alleged interception and towing occurred in a disputed area.
where_clear: Sea area northeast of Rhodes Island, within Turkish territorial waters (near Muğla's Fethiye district)
location_text_raw: northeast of Rhodes Island, inside Turkish territorial waters in position 36°25'48.0"N 28° 49'48.0"Ε.
uncertainty_note: Multiple locations and movements (detection, alleged interception, towing, rescue) are described by different sources (NGO, Greek authorities, Turkish Coast Guard), spanning both Greek and Turkish territorial waters. The provided coordinates correspond to the location of detection and rescue in Turkish territorial waters, which is the final known position before rescue.
context_note: An NGO reported that 64 migrants sailing from Türkiye to Rhodes were intercepted by the Hellenic Coast Guard (HCG) in a RHIB, their engine destroyed, belongings taken, and then towed by HCG vessel OPV 080 into Turkish territorial waters. The Turkish Coast Guard later rescued 64 migrants (51 irregular migrants and 13 children) from a drifting motor yacht in the same area. The Fundamental Rights Office finds it likely that the HCG was involved and that the motor yacht was in Greek territorial waters at some point, but could not independently corroborate the alleged interception and towing details. The modus operandi is consistent with HCG practices.
evidence_quote: the Fundamental Rights Office considers it likely that the Hellenic Coast Guard was involved in the incident but could not independently corroborate the facts as alleged in relation to interception, towing of the motor yacht and subsequent irregular return to Turkish territorial waters.

location_details: Libyan Search and Rescue Region (SRR)
context_note: Based on video evidence collected by the FSA which monitored the incident, the Fundamental Rights Office considers that excessive force was used by the Libyan authorities during the described incident, violating migrants' fundamental rights including to be free from inhuman or degrading treatment. Additionally, the Fundamental Rights Office is concerned about the safety of all rescued migrants upon disembarkation in Libya. In this respect, the Fundamental Rights Office invites dialogue on better coordination of search and rescue (SAR) activities in Central Mediterranean taking into consideration that Libya cannot be considered a place of safety.
evidence_quote: Frontex Surveillance Aircraft recorded the Libyan Coast Guard shooting at migrants during a search and rescue operation conducted in the Libyan Search and Rescue Region (SRR) on 15/09/2021.

location_details: Frontex Surveillance Aircraft Heron 1 detected a blue wooden boat at [redacted] with 20+ migrants on board in the Libyan Search and Rescue Region. The boat had one engine and was travelling with 6kts and course 360°. A LBY PV was in vicinity.
uncertainty_note: Specific coordinates redacted, only broad SRR mentioned.
context_note: Frontex Surveillance Aircraft recorded the Libyan Coast Guard shooting at migrants during a search and rescue operation. Excessive force was used by Libyan authorities, violating fundamental rights. Concern about safety of rescued migrants upon disembarkation in Libya, which is not considered a place of safety.
evidence_quote: Frontex Surveillance Aircraft recorded the Libyan Coast Guard shooting at migrants during a search and rescue operation conducted in the Libyan Search and Rescue Region (SRR) on 15/09/2021.

location_details: road between and the Turkish border
where_clear: Road near the Turkish border in Bulgaria
location_text_raw: road between and the Turkish border
uncertainty_note: Specific road and starting point are redacted/unspecified.
context_note: A Frontex patrol observed a man walking near the Turkish border in Bulgaria. The man, who spoke Arabic, had scratches on his arm. Later, two Bulgarian border police officers arrived and allegedly pounded the man's head and kicked him in the leg. The Bulgarian authorities later claimed the person was a Bulgarian national, not a migrant, and denied the alleged use of force, contradicting the Frontex officer's account. The Fundamental Rights Office could neither confirm nor disprove the allegations due to conflicting reports.
evidence_quote: One of them pounded his head from behind and kicked him in the leg.

location_details: Incident occurred near the Bulgarian-Turkish border, along a road between redacted villages. The man was found walking along the road between redacted locations and the Turkish border.
where_clear: Near the Bulgarian-Turkish border, along a road between villages.
location_text_raw: along the road between [REDACTED] and the Turkish border (a spot located between [REDACTED] villages).
uncertainty_note: Specific locations are redacted, only general area near Bulgarian-Turkish border is mentioned.
context_note: A Frontex officer and Bulgarian Border Police found a man near the Bulgarian-Turkish border. The man, who spoke Arabic, claimed to have crossed the border through a fence and had scratches. Another patrol of Bulgarian officers arrived, and one allegedly assaulted the man by pounding his head and kicking him. The man was then taken towards the Turkish border. Conflicting reports exist, with Bulgarian authorities claiming the man was a Bulgarian national and denied abuse, while the Frontex officer reported mistreatment of an Arabic-speaking migrant.
evidence_quote: One of the Bulgarian Officers pounded the man's head from behind and kicked him in the leg.

location_details: A Standing Corps Officer (SCO) was detained following a domestic altercation at their accommodation, then transferred to a local Police Station, and later escorted to court before the Judicial Authority.
where_clear: Accommodation, local Police Station, and court in an unspecified location.
uncertainty_note: Specific city and country are redacted.
context_note: A Standing Corps Officer (SCO) was temporarily detained by police following a domestic altercation with his spouse, leading to allegations of domestic violence. The SCO was transferred to a police station and later escorted to court.
evidence_quote: Alleged domestic violence by SC. SCO was detained due to alleged domestic altercation with his wife.

location_details: The incident occurred at the Pournara First Reception Centre in Cyprus, specifically in one of the containers not usually used for interviewing, after working hours. The migrant was apprehended at the disembarkation location in Cyprus by local officers supported by Frontex staff.
location_text_raw: premises of Pournara First Reception Centre in Cyprus
context_note: A migrant alleged ill-treatment during an interrogation by four unidentified officers at Pournara First Reception Centre in Cyprus on 21/07/2023. The migrant claimed he was slapped 4-5 times on the head and neck and forced to sign a statement that he had departed from Lebanon instead of Syria. The Fundamental Rights Office considers the allegations relatively credible but could not independently corroborate them due to lack of cooperation from Cypriot authorities.
evidence_quote: during this "interrogation" the migrant was slapped 4-5 times on the head and neck and was forced to sign a statement that he had departed from Lebanon and not Syria as he had claimed before.

context_note: An incident involving missing bullets from a weapon, discovered after an individual took a weapon from the weapons room. A subsequent ammunition count confirmed the missing bullets, and an investigation revealed inaccuracies in weapon registration information. The incident had potential negative implications on Frontex core tasks.
evidence_quote: bullets missing from a

location_details: An SC Officer's service laptop and other personal items were stolen from his car, which was parked at a hospital parking lot in Greece.
where_clear: Car broken into at a hospital parking lot in Greece.
uncertainty_note: Specific city and hospital name are redacted.
context_note: An SC Officer's service laptop and other personal items were stolen from his car, which was parked at a hospital parking lot in Greece while he was attending to a family health issue. Greek police launched a criminal investigation, but no useful evidence was found.
evidence_quote: On 23.09.2021, in [redacted] Greece, between 10:00 am and 15:10, unknown perpetrators, broke into the car of an SC Officer and stole his service bag with his service laptop inside. The vehicle was parked in [redacted] General Hospital's parking lot.

location_details: The incident occurred near the Albania-Montenegro border, close to a railroad, with GPS coordinates [redacted] as identified by the migrants. Migrants were walking along a railroad near the Albania-Montenegro border when they were stopped. This location is consistent with other similar incidents in the North-western Albania, near the Albania-Montenegro border, within approximately 2.5 km of each other.
where_clear: Along a railroad near the Albania-Montenegro border in North-western Albania.
location_text_raw: along a railroad near the Albania-Montenegro border
uncertainty_note: GPS coordinates were identified by migrants but are redacted in the document.
context_note: Six migrants were allegedly robbed of 150€ each by three men in Albanian police uniforms near the Albania-Montenegro border. The incident occurred around midnight on 16/08/2024. The Fundamental Rights Office assesses the migrants' accounts as credible and notes similarities with other incidents in the area, suggesting a pattern of exploitation. Albanian authorities' investigation did not confirm police involvement but the possibility of off-duty officers or civilians dressed as police is considered.
evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office received information from Frontex operational staff about six migrants who alleged being robbed by three men in Albanian police uniforms on 16/08/2024... while walking along a railroad near the Albania-Montenegro border.

location_details: An overcrowded migrant boat was detected by Frontex in the Libyan Search and Rescue Region (SRR). The Libyan Coast Security vessel P301 approached and performed the rescue. The incident occurred at sea within the Libyan SRR, approximately 20 NM from an unknown ship.
context_note: Video evidence established that violence was used by the Libyan Coast Security against people on board a migrant boat during onboarding, including hitting, kicking, and slapping. This is a frequent practice by Libyan authorities during rescue and interception. The subsequent disembarkation in Libya, an unsafe place, clearly violates the principle of non-refoulement.
evidence_quote: A recording made by [redacted] shows at least four crew members of the Libyan Coast Security vessel mistreating migrants during onboarding or immediately after.

location_details: Migrant boat detected in Libyan SRR at 33°54'00.0"N 12°35'00.0"E (Point 1), later rescued at 34°01'00.0″N 12°23'00.0″E (Point 3). All positions reported in this SIR are in Libyan search and rescue region, approx. 60 NM from the shore of Libya.
where_clear: Libyan Search and Rescue Region, near 33.9N 12.583E
location_text_raw: position 33°54'00.0"N 12°35'00.0"E at 00:54 UTC, Point 1 [Note. All positions reported in this SIR are in Libyan search and rescue region. Note Ends.]
context_note: Frontex surveillance aircraft sighted a migrant boat with 50+ people on board in the Libyan SRR on 08/03/2024, issued a Mayday Relay, but the search was suspended on 11/03/2024. The boat was rescued by an NGO on 13/03/2024, after allegedly 50 deaths. One of the two evacuated injured persons later died in hospital. The FRO concludes Libyan authorities failed to act, and Frontex's follow-up was insufficient, contributing to loss of life.
evidence_quote: On 22/08/2024, the Fundamental Rights Office was made aware of the incident when 25 migrants were rescued in Libyan search and rescue region by an NGO rescue vessel after allegedly spending six days at sea, which voyage reportedly resulted in at least 50 deaths.

location_details: Bulgaria after irregularly crossing from Greece [redacted]. Bulgaria-Greece green border. Greek territory. Evros river.
where_clear: Bulgaria-Greece green border, near the Evros river, after migrants crossed from Turkey to Greece, then to Bulgaria, then back to Greece.
location_text_raw: Bulgaria after irregularly crossing from Greece, Bulgaria-Greece green border, Evros river, Greek territory
uncertainty_note: Specific crossing points or locations along the border are not provided.
context_note: A group of 10 migrants, after crossing from Turkey to Greece, then to Bulgaria, were allegedly apprehended by Bulgarian police, beaten, stripped of clothes/phones, and forcibly returned to Greece. Bulgarian authorities deny the incident. FRO finds allegations credible due to consistency with other reports and detailed testimonies.
evidence_quote: A group of ten (10) migrants was detected and apprehended in Bulgaria after irregularly crossing from Greece [redacted]. Some of the migrants declared they were forced to take off their shoes and clothes and that their mobile phones were taken by Bulgarian police officers. Some of the migrants were allegedly beaten with sticks by Bulgarian police officers.

location_details: Bulgaria-Greece border, specifically the green border area, near a Greek village (name redacted) and involving a crossing of the Evros river. Within the JO Terra 2022 operational area.
location_text_raw: Bulgaria after irregularly crossing from Greece [redacted]
uncertainty_note: Specific village name and exact crossing points are redacted.
context_note: A group of 10 migrants was apprehended in Bulgaria after crossing from Greece. They alleged being transported to the Bulgaria-Greece green border, forced to remove clothes and shoes, had mobile phones taken, and were beaten with sticks by Bulgarian police, then forced back to Greece. Greek authorities later apprehended and assisted them. Bulgarian authorities denied the allegations, but FRO found them relatively credible due to consistency with other reports and the substantiated nature of migrant testimonies.
evidence_quote: A group of ten (10) migrants was detected and apprehended in Bulgaria after irregularly crossing from Greece [redacted]. Some of the migrants declared they were forced to take off their shoes and clothes and that their mobile phones were taken by Bulgarian police officers. Some of the migrants were allegedly beaten with sticks by Bulgarian police officers.

location_details: Bulgaria-Greece green border
context_note: Group of 10 migrants apprehended in Bulgaria after crossing from Greece. Allegations of forced undressing, confiscation of phones, beatings with sticks, and forced return to Greece by Bulgarian police.
evidence_quote: Some of the migrants declared they were forced to take off their shoes and clothes and that their mobile phones were taken by Bulgarian police officers. Some of the migrants were allegedly beaten with sticks by Bulgarian police officers.

location_details: Migrants crossed the Lithuanian border from Belarus in the area of Tverečius, Utenos Apskritis, Lithuania. They were stuck between Lithuanian and Belarusian border guards, experiencing multiple pushbacks and threats.
where_clear: Tverečius, Utenos Apskritis, Lithuania, near the Lithuanian-Belarusian border
context_note: A group of migrants crossed the Lithuanian border from Belarus, were pushed back by Lithuanian border guards, threatened by Belarusian guards, and later arrested by Lithuanian guards after multiple attempts to cross. A potential violation of fundamental rights was noted during interviews.
evidence_quote: they were stopped and pushed back by Lithuanian border guards and asked to return to Belarus. Later, the Belarusian border guards threatened them and forced them to go back to Lithuania.

location_details: Incident occurred in the sea area northwest of Symi island, within Hellenic territorial waters, heading towards the Greek coasts.
where_clear: Sea area northwest of Symi island, Greece
geocodable_query: sea area northwest of Symi island, Greece
context_note: On 23/08/2024, a fatal incident occurred near Symi island involving the Hellenic Coast Guard and a migrant boat. The Hellenic Coast Guard allegedly shot and killed a migrant during a pursuit, claiming the migrant boat performed dangerous manoeuvres and rammed their vessel. Migrant testimonies suggest they were trying to avoid arrest. The Fundamental Rights Office concluded that the use of lethal force was disproportionate and excessive, violating the right to life.
evidence_quote: On 23/08/2024, a fatal incident occurred at Symi island, involving the Hellenic Coast Guard and a migrant boat. It is alleged that the Hellenic Coast Guard shot and killed a migrant during a pursuit.

The described actions undertaken by the Turkish Coast Guard during the incident do not respect any coast guard protocols, nor maritime behavioural standards, which can be considered as a provocative behaviour.
evidence_quote: TCG patrol boat entered HTW and approached [redacted] performing dangerous manoeuvres.

uncertainty_note: Latitude and Longitude are redacted.
context_note: Migrants claimed to have been beaten by the Albanian Police on the evening of 05/09/2021 at the border of Kakavia. A group of 21 migrants from [redacted] including several minors, were on their way to Gjirocaster from the Greek side. Albanian police found them in a green area in the evening and apprehended them as they were getting into cars provided by traffickers. The migrants were then escorted in police cars to [redacted], where they spent the night. The next morning, during screening and debriefing activities, some of them reported being beaten by the police.

location_details: Apprehension of an unaccompanied boy by Frontex officers in the forest, followed by handover to Bulgarian Border Police, in the border region of Bulgaria with Turkey. Bulgarian authorities deny any record of the incident or the boy's whereabouts.
location_text_raw: in the forest, operational area, border region of Bulgaria's border with Turkey
uncertainty_note: Specific location details and coordinates are redacted in the document.
context_note: Frontex officers apprehended an unaccompanied minor and handed him over to Bulgarian Border Guards. Bulgarian authorities deny any record of the incident or the boy's detention, and the boy's whereabouts remain unknown. The Fundamental Rights Office expresses high concern over the disappearance and the likely violation of the child's rights, as well as the lack of transparency and investigation from Bulgarian authorities.
evidence_quote: Against the backdrop of the disappearance of the boy and Bulgarian authorities' claim that they boy was not in their care despite contrary Frontex witness reports, the Fundamental Rights Office concludes that it is highly likely that the basic rights of the child in question were infringed

location_details: Bulgarian border, where 2 Frontex [redacted] apprehended an unaccompanied minor and handed over to Bulgarian border police. Bulgarian authorities later claimed the minor was never in their care.
location_text_raw: On 24 August 2022, 2 Frontex [redacted] apprehended an unaccompanied minor [redacted] whom they handed over to Bulgarian border police.
context_note: Two Frontex officers apprehended an unaccompanied minor and handed him/her over to Bulgarian border police. Bulgarian authorities denied having the minor in their care. The minor's current status or whereabouts are unknown. The FRO concluded that the basic rights of the child were highly likely infringed.
evidence_quote: On 24 August 2022, 2 Frontex [redacted] apprehended an unaccompanied minor [redacted] whom they handed over to Bulgarian border police. Bulgarian authorities later claimed, in clear contrast to diligent internal reporting by Frontex, that the minor was never in their care based on the fact that he did not appear in their reports. The current legal status or whereabouts of the minor remain unknown.

Bulgarian authorities deny any record of the apprehension, and the boy's whereabouts are unknown. The Fundamental Rights Office concludes that the child's basic rights were likely infringed and urges investigation.
evidence_quote: Based on immediate, detailed, consistent and credible reporting by the officers of the Frontex Standing Corps, the Fundamental Right Office considers established that an apprehension of a person (self-declared minor) by Frontex officers and subsequent handover to Bulgarian authorities took place on [redacted] 2022.

location_details: The incident occurred in the sea area south of Lesvos Island, near Agrilia, within Hellenic Territorial Waters. The boat was initially detected 2 miles south of Agrilia.
where_clear: Sea area south of Lesvos Island, Greece
location_text_raw: near Lesvos Island, 2 miles south of Agrilia, inside the Hellenic Territorial Waters, sea area south-east of Lesvos island, inside the Hellenic Territorial Waters
uncertainty_note: The number of people on board varies across different reports, ranging from approximately 20 to 40 migrants.
context_note: Allegations of destruction of migrant boat's engine and towing to Turkish territorial waters by Hellenic Coast Guard. No corroborating evidence available, but if confirmed, it would amount to collective expulsion. Concerns raised about attempts by Hellenic authorities to influence Italian authorities' reporting, specifically regarding incident coordinates, which Italian authorities refused. FRO recommends Greek authorities to support SAR, review reporting systems, and investigate allegations of collective expulsion, and Frontex to sensitize officers on reporting serious incidents.
evidence_quote: On 08/10/2021 the Italian Frontex vessel operating near Lesvos Island intercepted a rubber boat with approx. 25/30 people on board. Hellenic Coast Guard was informed and its asset arrived on scene, and took over the incident from Frontex.

location_details: The incident occurred in the sea area near Lesvos Island, within Hellenic Territorial Waters, specifically in the southern area near Airport-Agrilias. The boat was later reported to be in the vicinity of the border line, moving towards Turkish coasts, and eventually immobilized within Turkish Territorial Waters.
where_clear: Sea area south-east of Lesvos Island, within Hellenic Territorial Waters, near the border with Turkey, eventually ending in Turkish Territorial Waters.
location_text_raw: near Lesvos Island, Hellenic Territorial Waters, south-east of Lesvos island, Turkish Territorial Waters, southern area of Lesvos, in the stretch of sea called Airport-Agrilias, sea area East of Lesvos island inside TTW, within Greek territorial waters, vicinity of the border line, towards the Turkish coasts, within Turkish territorial waters
geocodable_query: sea area south-east of Lesvos Island near Turkish border
uncertainty_note: It is not clear how the apprehended rubber boat ended back inside the Turkish Territorial Waters, and the exact location of the interception is disputed between Greek and Italian authorities.
context_note: An Italian Frontex vessel intercepted a rubber boat with migrants near Lesvos Island in Hellenic Territorial Waters. The Hellenic Coast Guard took over, and allegations arose of engine destruction and towing the boat to Turkish territorial waters. The Fundamental Rights Office notes similar methods by HCG in previous SIRs and expresses concern over attempts by Italian authorities to influence reporting. The Hellenic Coast Guard claims the boat moved towards Turkish waters on its own to avoid arrest. No corroborating evidence for engine destruction or towing was found, but if confirmed, it would constitute collective expulsion.
evidence_quote: According to the people on board, Frontex asset handed them over to a grey Greek-flagged boat, whose crew destroyed the migrant boat's engine and towed the migrants back towards Turkey where they had been left adrift.

context_note: A citizen presented an expired residence permit at border checks in Bulgaria. The car driver attempted to bribe an official with 70 EUR for safe passage. The official refused the bribe and informed the driver of the legal consequences. Further questioning revealed a previous bribe attempt of 100 EUR on 06/08/2023 during a journey from Germany to Turkey. The residence permit was later verified as valid, allowing entry to Bulgaria and the Schengen area.
evidence_quote: A citizen presented at the border checks travel documents, among which, an expired since beginning of 2023, residence permit. Further, the driver of the car tried to bribe with seventy (70) EUR.

context_note: A Frontex team had a car accident with a Romanian private car outside a town in Romania while commuting. No one was injured, but the service car was severely damaged. Police and Romanian Border Police Officers provided assistance.
evidence_quote: On 19/10/2021 at approximately [redacted] local time, the [redacted] team, on their way to [redacted] had a car accident outside the town of [redacted] involving a Romanian private car. No one was injured in the accident.

location_details: A Frontex member apprehended 2 migrants who had crossed a border river. The incident occurred in a river area, beyond the river, where the terrain was not easily accessible by car. The migrants were transported partially outside the vehicle, sometimes standing on the running board, across the riverbed to the main road.
where_clear: Border river area, land, where migrants were apprehended after crossing a river.
uncertainty_note: Specific country and exact border location are redacted. Described as a 'river area' and 'border'.
context_note: A Frontex member was alleged to have endangered two migrants by transporting them partially outside a vehicle after they crossed a border river. The Fundamental Rights Office concluded that such an incident likely occurred, putting the migrants' health at risk. A video of the incident was reportedly shared and deleted. Systemic issues regarding reporting, protocols for precautionary measures, and data access were identified.
evidence_quote: two migrants were transported (partially) outside the car by a member of Frontex [...] The Office does not know the exact details of the event, which has likely put health of migrants transported at risk.

location_details: Evros, Greece
uncertainty_note: Latitude and Longitude are redacted in the document.
context_note: Ten irregular migrants apprehended in Evros, Greece, alleged robbery, violent deportation from Bulgaria to Greece by Bulgarian police, and forced abandonment of belongings. FRO assessed potential serious breaches of fundamental rights, including degrading treatment, right to life, integrity, asylum, human dignity, prohibition of torture, collective expulsion, and lack of effective remedy, citing EU Charter articles. Bulgarian authorities' information was insufficient to corroborate or refute allegations.
evidence_quote: On 01/10/2021 apprehended ten irregular migrants of Greek Police officers. All of them stated: i) that they were allegedly victims of robbery and violent deportation from Bulgaria to Greece, by the Bulgarian police authorities; (ii) that they were reportedly forced to leave their clothes, shoes and telephones in Bulgaria.

location_details: Operational area
context_note: Ten irregular migrants apprehended by Greek Police in Ormenio village, Evros, Greece, alleged robbery and violent deportation from Bulgaria by Bulgarian police, including being forced to abandon clothes, shoes, and telephones. FRO assessed these allegations could amount to serious breaches of fundamental rights, including degrading treatment, collective expulsion, and lack of effective remedy.
evidence_quote: allegedly victims of robbery and violent deportation from Bulgaria to Greece, by the Bulgarian police authorities; (ii) that they were reportedly forced to leave their clothes, shoes and telephones in Bulgaria.

location_details: The incident occurred in the sea area near Samos Island, within International Waters and the Greek SAR Region, involving a migrant boat that was initially detected near Samos and later observed moving towards Turkish Territorial Waters, with physical contact and escorting by a Hellenic Coast Guard asset.
where_clear: Sea area near Samos Island, International Waters, Greek SAR Region, moving towards Turkish Territorial Waters.
location_text_raw: Samos Island, Turkish coasts, Turkish Territorial Waters, International Waters, Greek SAR Region, JO Poseidon 2022
country_or_area: Greece, Turkey, International Waters, Aegean Sea
context_note: This SIR details significant discrepancies between reports from Frontex and the Hellenic Coast Guard (HCG) regarding a migrant boat incident near Samos Island. While Greek authorities stated the boat voluntarily altered course towards Turkish waters, video evidence and crew testimonies indicated physical contact and escorting by HCG in a northerly direction, suggesting an interception and potential pushback. The report highlights concerns about frequent allegations of pushbacks by HCG and a lack of transparency from Greek authorities.
evidence_quote: the video evidence contradicts this by clearly showing the migrant boat and [redacted] in physical contact side-by-side while moving north.

location_text_raw: Bulgarian border with Turkey (JO Terra 2022, operational area)

evidence_quote: Allegations of systematic so-called pushbacks and excessive use of force by Bulgarian authorities.

location_details: Bulgarian border with Turkey, within the JO Terra 2022 operational area. Incidents occurred across various locations along the border.
uncertainty_note: Incidents are aggregated over several months and locations are not precisely specified beyond the border area.
context_note: A Frontex Standing Corps Officer reported allegations of systematic pushbacks and excessive use of force by Bulgarian authorities, based on informal conversations with ten Bulgarian Border Guard Officers. The reporting person did not personally witness incidents. Allegations include migrants getting injured, stripped of belongings, forced to swim, and degrading language. Bulgarian authorities denied the allegations, and FRO could not independently corroborate them but found them relatively credible and consistent with other reports.
evidence_quote: Allegations of fundamental rights violations in the present SIR were denied by the Bulgarian authorities and could not be independently corroborated by the Fundamental Rights Office. The Office nonetheless expresses its concern about the allegations of so-called pushbacks and excessive use of force by Bulgarian authorities and underlines that these allegations are consistent with other reports in form of previous SIRs and NGO reports.

location_details: Turkish-Bulgarian border in Edirne area, Bulgarian territory, including a farmhouse and a forest close to the border.
uncertainty_note: Specific location of farmhouse and forest not identified, only general area near Edirne. FRO research to locate the apprehension site was inconclusive.
context_note: A group of 28 migrants irregularly crossed the Turkish-Bulgarian border in Edirne area. They were apprehended by Bulgarian police, taken to a farmhouse, beaten by military, forced to work for seven hours, had arms broken, and were pushed back to Turkey on 13 or 14/08/2022. Bulgarian authorities denied the allegations, and the FRO could not independently corroborate all facts, but considers the allegations relatively credible based on patterns.
evidence_quote: Bulgarian soldiers beat the migrants from both groups, took their belongings (phones, money, shoes, documents) and forced them to work at the farmhouse for seven hours. The military then took all the migrants into a forest close to the border. There, the officers broke the arms of some of the migrants before pushing all of them across the border to Turkey (on 13 or 14/08/2022).

location_details: Incident occurred in the Aegean Sea, specifically in the sea area of Chios Island, near Gridia, within Hellenic territorial waters.
where_clear: Off Chios Island, Aegean Sea, Greece
location_text_raw: outside Gridia, Chios South East / Aegean Sea / sea area of Chios Island inside the Hellenic territorial waters
context_note: A boat reportedly carrying 27 people was in distress off Chios Island, Greece. A Search and Rescue (SAR) operation was launched involving the Hellenic Coast Guard, a German NATO vessel, and helicopters. The operation resulted in 22 people rescued, 4 dead bodies recovered (3 children and 1 woman), and 2 people remaining missing. The report also highlights potential fundamental rights violations and the response from Hellenic authorities.
evidence_quote: The SAR operation was concluded with the following result: 22 migrants rescued, 4 corpses recovered, 2 migrants missing.

location_details: A migrant boat was initially detected in the Maltese Search and Rescue Region, 37 NM south from Lampedusa, at coordinates 34°53'00.0"N 12°37'00.0″E. It was subsequently sighted at 30 NM and 26 NM from Lampedusa, still within the Maltese SRR. The rescue operation took place 10 NM from Lampedusa in Italian territorial waters. The boat departed from Sabratha, Libya.
where_clear: Maltese Search and Rescue Region, initially 37 NM south of Lampedusa (34.883333N, 12.616667E), moving towards Lampedusa; rescue occurred 10 NM south of Lampedusa in Italian territorial waters.

uncertainty_note: Multiple positions reported over time, final rescue location described by distance from Lampedusa. Coordinates refer to initial detection.
context_note: A migrant boat with approximately 30 people departed from Sabratha, Libya. It was detected on 02/09/2024 in the Maltese SAR region by NGO Sea-Watch, which reported it to Maltese and Italian authorities. The boat capsized multiple times due to bad weather, leading to at least 6 confirmed deaths and 21 missing persons. Seven migrants were rescued on 04/09/2024 by Italian Coast Guard in Italian territorial waters, two days after initial detection. The Fundamental Rights Office is investigating the delayed rescue and potential violation of the right to life due to alleged inaction and lack of coordination by authorities.
evidence_quote: On 04/09/2024, seven migrants were rescued by Italian Coast Guard vessel (Frontex asset) from a capsized boat ten NM from Lampedusa (Italian territorial waters). ... At least six people drowned including three minors. ... 21 persons missing: Italian non-assistance likely leads to shipwreck

location_details: A group of eight migrants, including a minor, was encountered by Frontex officers near a police station in Greece, after being refused entry to North Macedonia. They were handed over to Hellenic Police and later taken away by a police bus to an unknown location, with conflicting claims of a nearby hotel or the North Macedonian border.

context_note: A group of eight migrants, including a minor, was apprehended by Frontex officers near a police station in Greece after being refused entry to North Macedonia. They were handed over to Hellenic Police, who allegedly failed to conduct proper identification and vulnerability assessments. The migrants were subsequently taken away by a police bus to an unknown location, with conflicting accounts of their destination. The Fundamental Rights Office concluded that proper identification, registration, and special needs assessment, particularly for the minor, were likely not applied.
evidence_quote: During its investigation, the Fundamental Rights Office collected information on an additional similar incident (on 07/09/2024) where the Hellenic authorities [redacted] reportedly didn't register a group of eight [redacted] migrants including a minor, who were apprehended/brought by Frontex to the police station.

The migrant was handed over to Hellenic Police and subsequently taken away, but the exact destination and procedures followed remain unclear and contradictory. The Fundamental Rights Office concluded that proper identification, registration, and medical assistance procedures were likely not applied.

The report alleged that in at least one instance (incident on 10/09/2024) when Frontex detected a migrant near the police station o [redacted] Hellenic Police officers from [redacted] failed to correctly identify, register and provide medical assistance.

location_details: Incident occurred at the border fence in Bulgaria, near a redacted village. Migrants were initially spotted kneeling behind Bulgarian officers by the border fence. They were later transported to a redacted location and then to another redacted detention facility.
where_clear: Bulgarian border fence, near a village
location_text_raw: border fence, in the area of the [REDACTED], territory of the village of [REDACTED], detention facility located in the building of [REDACTED]
uncertainty_note: Specific village name and coordinates are redacted. General area is the Bulgarian border fence.
context_note: Frontex officers observed Bulgarian officers treating migrants harshly, confiscating belongings, and attempting to collectively expel them to Türkiye. Bulgarian officers tried to block Frontex access to migrants and created a hostile work environment, including instructing Frontex officers not to report incidents and subjecting them to repercussions for reporting. The Fundamental Rights Office notes recurring similar incidents and concerns about systemic issues. While migrants showed visible bruises, they claimed these were from time spent in the forest, making the direct cause of injury unclear, though ill-treatment is considered likely by FRO.
evidence_quote: Based on the available information, the Fundamental Rights Office considers it likely that the migrants were treated by the Bulgarian officers with unnecessary force and their belongings were confiscated.

location_details: The incident occurred in a detention facility within the JO Indalo Operational Area in Spain. Migrants were under detention, and a room search was conducted by the National Police Corps (CNP). The incident date is stated as 24/25.09.2022, with migrants claiming 24.09.2022 and Spanish authorities claiming 25.09.2022. The report notes the incident occurred anytime between the evening of 24.09.2022 and the early morning hours of 25.09.2022.
where_clear: Detention facility in JO Indalo Operational Area, Spain
context_note: Three migrants claimed they were beaten with rubber batons by officers of the Spanish National Police Corps (CNP) after a room search in a detention facility. The search was initiated because one migrant was smoking a cigarette. Frontex observed injuries on the migrants. The Fundamental Rights Office was unable to establish if the use of force was necessary and proportionate and noted that Spanish authorities did not confirm a formal investigation into the allegations.
evidence_quote: Three (3) migrants claimed that on 24.09.2022 they had been beaten up with a rubber baton by officers of the National Police Corps (CNP) while in [redacted] (Spain).

They did not duly inform about their absence.

They were then taken to an abandoned building nearby. The incident occurred in North-western Albania, along the Albania-Montenegro railway line, within an approximate range of 2.5 kilometers from the border.

context_note: Four Syrian migrants were allegedly robbed by three men in Albanian police uniforms near the Albania-Montenegro border. The migrants were threatened with arrest and deportation if they did not hand over money. They gave 200 € and were then allowed to continue their travel. The Fundamental Rights Office assesses it is likely the migrants were victims of robbery, but the involvement of Albanian law enforcement officials remains unclear. Similar incidents have been reported in the same area, suggesting a pattern of exploitation.
evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office received information from Frontex operational staff about four migrants allegedly being robbed by three men in Albanian police uniforms on 27/09/2024. According to the migrants the group was stopped by the alleged police officers close to the Albania-Montenegro border.

They were apprehended on 02/08/2024 near Didymoteicho, Greece, and later transferred to an area near the Evros river for forced return to the Turkish side of the river. Specific points of entry and arrest were known but redacted.

The group of ten migrants was apprehended by Greek police, handed over to unidentified individuals (Afghan nationals) wearing masks, subjected to invasive body searches, sexual harassment, and then forced back to Türkiye in an inflatable boat. The Fundamental Rights Office finds the migrant's account credible.

location_details: The incident occurred in the Libyan search and rescue region (SRR). Frontex aircraft sighted the migrant boat in the Central Mediterranean prior to the incident. The migrant boat was attempting to reach the Italian island of Lampedusa. Migrants were disembarked in Libya.
uncertainty_note: Specific points (Point 1, Point 2, etc.) are mentioned but their coordinates are redacted.
context_note: On 21/09/2024, a Libyan Coast Guard vessel fired shots at a migrant boat in the Libyan SRR. An NGO aircraft witnessed the event and reported it. Frontex aircraft had sighted the migrant boat approximately 50 minutes prior to the incident and transmitted information to relevant rescue coordination centers, including Libyan. Frontex assets were not on site during the shooting. The Fundamental Rights Office concluded that shots were likely fired in close proximity to the migrant boat, endangering lives. All migrants were subsequently disembarked in Libya, which is not considered a place of safety.
evidence_quote: On 21/09/2024, at 11:37 UTC, at least two men on board of a Libyan Coast Guard vessel fired shots at a migrant boat.

context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office finds that migrants were assisted by NGO Geo Barents 2+ hours after detection by the Frontex aerial asset. With the available information, the Fundamental Rights Office could not conclusively establish the condition of the migrants inside the boat at the time of detection or the overall duration of their journey at sea which could have led to the death of the 10 migrants on board. The Fundamental Rights Office notes that Frontex aerial asset remained on site and monitored the area of the incident and that the [redacted] acted in line with applicable legal framework and operational procedures. As regards the actions by the relevant authorities, the Fundamental Rights Office understands that Frontex team leaders did not receive a reaction or information on their cooperation/coordination of the case and underlines the importance of timely communication by all involved stakeholders. In light of the importance of such exchange and updated information, it commends the exchange between Frontex TL and IT SAR expert which allowed the FSA to proceed on site.
evidence_quote: On 16 November 2021 at 10:41 UTC, Heron 1 spotted a white wooden boat adrift with 100+ migrants on board inside the Libyan search and rescue zone, after having received respective information by the Italian Search and Rescue (SAR) expert on a possible overcrowded migrant boat in distress and people in the water. Three Mayday calls were broadcasted on maritime CH16 by Heron 1. Migrants were rescued by the NGO Geo Barents and disembarked in Messina port (IT). Reportedly, 10 people were found dead at the bottom of the boat.

location_details: The incident occurred near Kos island, Greece. The migrant boat started its journey from Bodrum, Türkiye, and was intercepted by the Hellenic Coast Guard near the shore of Kos, in the sea area East of Kos island, within Hellenic territorial waters, specifically in the maritime area of Cape Fokas.
where_clear: Near Kos island, Greece, in the sea area East of Kos island, within Hellenic territorial waters, near Cape Fokas.
context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office received information that a migrant boat carrying approximately 12-15 people was intercepted by a Hellenic Coast Guard (HCG) vessel near Kos island. Migrants alleged HCG officers boarded their boat, broke down the engine, confiscated phones, tied the boat to the HCG vessel, and towed it to open sea despite rough weather. The boat capsized, resulting in one drowning and 14 survivors. The FRO considers the migrants' account credible and the interception, engine destruction, and towing likely. The capsizing is also considered likely due to HCG actions, potentially violating the right to life. Collective expulsion remains unclear due to insufficient information.
evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office received information that during [redacted] migrants alleged that their boat, carrying approximately 12-15 people, was intercepted by a Hellenic Coast Guard (HCG) vessel near Kos island on 27/09/2024. According to the migrants, the HCG officers boarded their boat, broke down the engine, and confiscated their mobile phones. The migrants further alleged that the HCG officers tied their boat to the HCG vessel and towed it for approximately 30 minutes to the open sea, despite rough weather conditions. The boat eventually capsized, resulting in the drowning of one migrant and the rescue of 14 survivors by the HCG.

location_details: SW of Crete island

location_details: Migrants were held in a garage adjacent to the main building of a Border Crossing Unit (BCU) in Serbia, near Pirot. The garage dimensions are 8.5m x 8.5m x 4m. It is not adapted for holding people, lacks furniture, ventilation, natural light, and sanitary facilities. Registration and office rooms are air-conditioned. The facility is located at Serbia's border.
where_clear: Garage at a Border Crossing Unit (BCU) building in Serbia, near Pirot.
location_text_raw: garage adjacent to the main building of [REDACTED]
geocodable_query: Border Crossing Unit building, Pirot, Serbia
uncertainty_note: Specific facility name and exact border crossing location are redacted.
context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office was made aware of Frontex operational reporting about apprehended migrants being brought to a redacted location for registration and allegedly held for hours in degrading conditions. On 30/09/2024, one migrant fainted while being locked in a garage-like structure with other 30 migrants for at least 14 hours. It was also reported that the same day at around 17:00 at least 45 migrants were held in the garage, with 30 of them already being there no less than 20 hours. The Office considers it established that migrants were held in the garage adjacent to the main building of a BCU on a regular basis over 2023-2024, on occasion even up to 20 hours. The detention of migrants in such conditions, considering the general conditions of the garage, the size of migrant groups, and long waiting hours, likely amounts to degrading treatment.
evidence_quote: On 30/09/2024, one migrant fainted while being locked in a garage-like structure with other 30 migrants for at least 14 hours.

location_details: Various incidents categorized as 'Other cases', including detention conditions at Border Crossing Units and incidents on exit from the country.

uncertainty_note: The Fundamental Rights Office is aware of a migrant boat that was sighted by Frontex in the area where Alarm Phone reported the incident but was not able to assess whether the vessels are the same. Furthermore, as regards the migrant boat sighted by the Frontex Surveillance Aircraft, a revision of sighting and mission reports as well as exchange with respective Frontex Team Leaders and managers responsible for aerial surveillance made clear that the Frontex asset did not witness any Libyan intervention. For this reason, the occurrence of the incident could not be corroborated using internal data.
context_note: Alarm Phone alleged that the Libyan Coast Guard was shooting at migrants during a search and rescue operation in the Maltese Search and Rescue Region (SRR) on 24/11/2021. The Fundamental Rights Office is aware of a migrant boat that was sighted by Frontex in the area where Alarm Phone reported the incident but was not able to assess whether the vessels are the same. Furthermore, as regards the migrant boat sighted by the Frontex Surveillance Aircraft, a revision of sighting and mission reports as well as exchange with respective Frontex Team Leaders and managers responsible for aerial surveillance made clear that the Frontex asset did not witness any Libyan intervention. For this reason, the occurrence of the incident could not be corroborated using internal data.
evidence_quote: Alarm Phone alleged that the Libyan Coast Guard was shooting at migrants during a search and rescue operation in the Maltese Search and Rescue Region (SRR) on 24/11/2021.

location_details: A Fundamental Rights Monitor observed two debriefing interviews conducted by a Frontex debriefer on Lanzarote Island, Spain, during a Frontex joint operation (Canary Islands 2024).
context_note: A Fundamental Rights Monitor observed two debriefing interviews conducted by a Frontex debriefer on Lanzarote Island, reporting alleged violations of privacy and personal data protection safeguards. The debriefer reportedly did not ask for specific consent or provide full explanations, nor offered an opportunity to stop the interviews.
evidence_quote: The report describes alleged violations of privacy and personal data protection safeguards during these debriefing interviews.

location_text_raw: Varėnos rajono savivaldybė, Alytaus Apskritis, Lithuania
