context_note: MSF reported a group of migrants with children denied asylum and expelled from Lithuania to Belarus on Dec 1, 2021, after temporary admission and basic assistance. One child was seriously ill, and harsh winter conditions prevailed. Lithuania claims the family voluntarily returned. The incident is linked to new Lithuanian border management procedures and potential derogations from human rights obligations during a public emergency.
evidence_quote: a group of migrants with children who reported that they had been denied the right to apply for asylum and were expelled from Lithuania to Belarus

location_details: The incident occurred close to the Albania-Montenegro border, along a road where the migrant was walking. The location is described as having a railway and a car road visible, with a container nearby. This area is consistent with other reported incidents in North-western Albania, with approximate coordinates showing a maximum distance of 2.5 km among incidents.
where_clear: Near Albania-Montenegro border, along a road with railway and a container nearby.
uncertainty_note: Specific GPS coordinates were mentioned but redacted in the document. However, the general area is consistently described and cross-referenced with other SIRs, indicating a known approximate location.
context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office assesses that it is likely that the migrant was a victim of robbery, although the involvement of Albanian law enforcement officials in the incident remains unclear. The incident is part of a pattern of systematic exploitation and abuse of migrants by a group of unknown perpetrators in the North-western Albania, near the Albania-Montenegro border. Six similar reports have been received since August 2024.
evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office received information from Frontex operational staff about a migrant allegedly being robbed by three men in seemingly Albanian police uniforms on 08/10/2024.

location_details: The incident occurred during screening activities on shore at Cala Pañon Cortado, Cuevas del Almanzora, Almería, Spain, involving a group of 17 Algerian migrants.
where_clear: Cala Pañon Cortado, Cuevas del Almanzora, Almería, Spain
location_text_raw: on shore at Cala Pañon Cortado, Cuevas del Almanzora (Almería)
geocodable_query: Cala Pañon Cortado, Cuevas del Almanzora, Almería, Spain
context_note: A migrant reported being slapped, hit/pushed, and forced to carry a box by a Spanish officer during screening activities on shore in Almería. The Fundamental Rights Office finds it unclear if the ill-treatment occurred, as the migrant had no visible injuries and declined medical assistance.
evidence_quote: a migrant reported having been slapped in the face, hit/pushed in the stomach and pushed in the back by a Spanish officer.

location_details: Chios Island
where_clear: Sea area near Chios Island, Greece, after crossing from Turkish territorial waters.
location_text_raw: Greece, , Greece; Chios Island; Turkish territorial waters; Chios Island inside TTW; Hellenic territorial waters
uncertainty_note: Exact coordinates are redacted. Incident involved crossing from Turkish to Greek territorial waters near Chios Island. Initial reports mentioned towing back to Turkey, but final outcome states rescue to Chios Island.
context_note: Incident involved a rubber boat with 8 migrants detected near Chios Island. Initial reports suggested an attempt to tow the boat back to Turkey, but the final outcome, corroborated by Hellenic authorities, states all migrants were rescued and transferred to Chios Island by an HCG asset. Frontex recommends closing the SIR.
evidence_quote: Serious Incident Report no. 14692/2021. Subject: Incoming flow incident with possible infringements to fundamental rights. All eight persons on board were finally rescued and transferred to Chios Island by an HCG asset. FRO recommends the closure of the SIR.

uncertainty_note: Exact location on Samos island and subsequent journey points are redacted or not precisely specified.
context_note: The incident involves allegations of a 'pushback' operation by the Hellenic Coast Guard, where migrants were allegedly apprehended on a small island near Samos, transported by various boats, and ultimately transferred to a Turkish boat. The report highlights potential violations of fundamental rights, including collective expulsion, degrading treatment, and lack of effective remedy, despite national authorities stating no evidence to corroborate the allegations. FRO emphasizes the risks in such incidents and recommends actions for Hellenic authorities and Frontex regarding transparency, training, safeguards, and potential deployment of Fundamental Rights Monitors.
evidence_quote: The incident involves allegations on so called „pushback" of migrants conducted by the Hellenic Coast Guard to the border with Turkey without taking into consideration the personal circumstances of people present on board.

location_details: A migrant boat was intercepted by a Hellenic Coast Guard vessel near Kos island, Greece.
context_note: A migrant boat with approximately 30 people was intercepted near Kos island by the Hellenic Coast Guard. Migrants alleged HCG actions, including creating waves and firing shots, led to the boat swamping and 4 deaths. FRO found migrant accounts credible regarding the swamping and deaths, but gunshots remain unconfirmed.
evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office considers it likely that the actions by the Hellenic authorities caused the swamping of the migrant boat and therefore led to the death of four migrants.

location_details: The incident occurred in the Greek Search and Rescue Region (SRR), specifically in the sea area south of Crete Island, near Gavdos Island.
where_clear: Sea area south of Crete Island, Greece
location_text_raw: in Greek search and rescue region (SRR)
geocodable_query: Sea area south of Crete Island, Greece
context_note: Frontex surveillance aircraft detected a migrant boat in the Greek SRR, south of Crete Island, and issued a Mayday Relay. The boat initially headed north, then changed course south towards a container ship. Migrants attempted to disembark onto the container ship, during which the migrant boat sank. Frontex aircraft assisted in the search. Ultimately, 97 people were rescued, one body was recovered, and two people were declared missing. The SIR was launched to clarify the reasons for the rescue occurring several hours after initial detection.
evidence_quote: On 15/10/2024, a Frontex surveillance aircraft detected a migrant boat in Greek search and rescue region (SRR) and issued a Mayday Relay. ... On 16/10/2025, the Greek authorities reported that 97 people were rescued, one body recovered and two people declared missing.

location_details: Border Crossing Point (BCP) in Lithuania, specifically at the border with Belarus, where a family was refused entry.
uncertainty_note: Specific BCP name is redacted in the document.
context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office received a report describing two occasions (21/10/2024 and 28/10/2024) when a family of three nationals was reportedly refused entry at a Border Crossing Point (BCP) in Lithuania, despite allegedly asking for asylum. The family was issued formal decisions for refusal of entry and turned back to Belarus. Lithuanian authorities stated they had no record of an asylum application. The FRO notes concern about shrinking access to asylum procedures at Lithuania's borders and regrets that Lithuanian authorities decided not to investigate the incident.
evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office received a report describing two occasions when persons reportedly asking for asylum at the Border Crossing Point (BCP) Lithuania were refused entry.

location_details: Incident occurred at a Border Crossing Point (BCP) in Lithuania, on the border with Belarus. The specific BCP name is redacted. The family was turned back to Belarus on both occasions.
where_clear: Border Crossing Point on Lithuania-Belarus border
location_text_raw: Border Crossing Point (BCP) Lithuania, BCP, Lithuanian side, border crossing points with Belarus and Russia
geocodable_query: Border Crossing Point Lithuania Belarus border
uncertainty_note: Specific Border Crossing Point name is redacted.
context_note: A family of three nationals attempted to seek asylum at a Border Crossing Point in Lithuania on two separate occasions (21/10/2024 and 28/10/2024) after arriving from Belarus. On both occasions, they were refused entry due to lack of valid visas/residence permits and turned back to Belarus. The family claims to have asked for asylum, but Lithuanian authorities state no such application was submitted. The Fundamental Rights Office notes concerns about shrinking access to asylum procedures at Lithuania's borders and the authorities' decision not to investigate the incident.
evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office considers it established that three nationals were present at BCP on 21/10/2024 and 28/10/2024 but cannot confirm with certainty whether they voiced their intention to apply for international protection and whether access to the asylum procedure was denied.

where_clear: Airport waiting area in Greece during a pre-departure phase of a joint return operation.
location_text_raw: Greece, waiting area of the airport
uncertainty_note: Specific airport not identified, only 'airport in Greece'.
context_note: During a joint return operation to Georgia and Pakistan, unidentified officers were present in the airport waiting area during the pre-departure phase, which was not in line with procedures and caused concerns among returnees and staff. Additionally, a flight was not authorized to land, causing delays.
evidence_quote: As reported by the Frontex Representative on board deployed on this operation, during the pre-departure phase, [redacted] officers [redacted] were present in the waiting area of the airport, guarding the returnees, and looking on the implementation of the pre-departure operations.

location_details: Incident occurred on Serbian territory, approximately 1-2 km from the Serbian-Romanian border, near the A166 border sign. Romanian border police entered Serbian territory and stopped a group of 8 persons near the border line, who were then taken over by a Serbian police patrol.
where_clear: Serbian territory, near the Serbian-Romanian border, close to A166 border sign.
geocodable_query: Serbian-Romanian border, near A166 border sign, Serbia
context_note: Frontex aerial surveillance observed Romanian border guards and a group of 8 persons in Serbian territory. A second vehicle (Serbian police) arrived and took over the group. Romanian authorities stated this was a 'normal prevention of illegal crossing' and no further investigation is needed. The Fundamental Rights Office noted serious shortcomings in procedural safeguards and potential violations of fundamental rights, including collective expulsion, right to an effective remedy, and non-refoulement.
evidence_quote: Frontex aerial surveillance asset (FSA) recorded two alleged Romanian border guards and 6+ persons standing next to a Border Patrol vehicle within Serbian territory.

location_details: Close to the Albania-Montenegro border, in the area of Hani - I - Hotit. Migrants were walking on the railroad track. Approximate GPS coordinates were indicated, but not precise. The incident took place in the same area as previous SIRs, specifically in North-western Albania, near the Albania-Montenegro border.
where_clear: Hani i Hotit, Albania-Montenegro border area
location_text_raw: close to the Albania-Montenegro border, in the area of Hani - I - Hotit.
uncertainty_note: Coordinates provided were not precise and were redacted. Location is described as 'close to' and 'in the area of'.
context_note: Four migrants were allegedly robbed by three men in seemingly Albanian police uniforms near the Albania-Montenegro border. Money and cell phones were taken, and one migrant was slapped. The Fundamental Rights Office assesses it is likely the migrants were victims of robbery and degrading treatment. The incident shows similarities with other SIRs in the same area, suggesting a pattern of exploitation and abuse by unknown perpetrators, possibly impersonating law enforcement.
evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office received information from Frontex operational staff about four migrants allegedly robbed by three men in seemingly Albanian police uniforms on 07/11/2024. According to the migrants the group was stopped by the alleged police officers close to the Albania-Montenegro border, in the area of Hani - I - Hotit. The men in uniforms took the cell phones from the migrants, searched and ordered them to hand over their money. Three of the migrants handed all their money over to the three men, which amounted to 150 €. The fourth migrant had no money and was slapped in the face by one of the men.

location_details: Incident occurred in the Libyan Search and Rescue Region (SRR) involving a Libyan Coast Security vessel P301 and a migrant boat with approximately 60 people. The mistreatment of a migrant took place on the Libyan Coast Security vessel.
context_note: A Frontex surveillance aircraft observed a Libyan Coast Security vessel P301 mistreating a migrant during a rescue operation in the Libyan SRR. The migrant was forcibly removed from a boat and beaten with a yellow rope. This incident highlights a pattern of violence by Libyan authorities during rescues and subsequent disembarkation in unsafe places, as Libya cannot be considered a place of safety.
evidence_quote: A recording made shows at least two crew members of the Libyan Coast Security vessel mistreating a migrant while forcibly removing him from the migrant boat. ... one crew member hits the lying person with a yellow rope seven times, then passes the rope to another member who hits the victim another five times.

location_details: Interception point at 38°55'42.7" N, 26°26′26.8"E, approximately 4 km from the shore, south of Lesvos Island, Greek territorial waters. The incident involved movement towards Turkish territorial waters and rescue off İzmir's Dikili district.
where_clear: South of Lesvos Island, Aegean Sea, near the maritime border between Greece and Türkiye.
location_text_raw: sailing from Türkiye to south of Lesvos
uncertainty_note: The concrete location provided by the NGO could not be independently corroborated by the Office, though the Office is certain the video was shot in Greek territorial waters and in the vicinity of the NGO's reported location.
context_note: A group of 34 irregular migrants sailing from Türkiye to Greece was allegedly subjected to collective expulsion by the Hellenic Coast Guard on 29/09/2023. A rigid-hull inflatable boat intercepted the migrant boat, removed fuel, towed it to a Hellenic Coast Guard vessel. Migrants were taken aboard, belongings confiscated, sailed to Turkish territorial waters, forced into two life rafts, abandoned at sea, and subsequently rescued by the Turkish Coast Guard. The Office found the NGO report credible and concluded that migrants were likely subjected to a collective expulsion.
evidence_quote: On 08/10/2023, NGO Aegean Boat Report published information online, alleging that a group of 34 irregular migrants, sailing from Türkiye to Greece, was on 29/09/2023 subjected to collective expulsion by Hellenic Coast Guard.

location_details: The rescue occurred in the Tunisian and Libyan SRR, approximately 30 NM from Libyan shore, 25 NM from Tunisian, 120 NM from Lampedusa, Italy and 190 NM from Malta. Medical evacuation was performed in the Maltese SRR, 26 NM from Lampedusa and 110 NM from Malta, 95 NM from the position where the migrant boat was rescued. Disembarkation initially assigned to Ravenna (800 NM away), later changed to Pozzallo, Sicily.
where_clear: Tunisian and Libyan Search and Rescue Region (SRR), near the borders of Maltese SRR, Central Mediterranean Sea.
location_text_raw: Tunisian and Libyan search and rescue region (SRR), approximately 30 NM from Libyan shore, 25 NM from Tunisian, 120 NM from Lampedusa, Italy and 190 NM from Malta. Medical evacuation in the Maltese SRR, 26 NM from Lampedusa and 110 NM from Malta.
country_or_area: Tunisian and Libyan SRR, Maltese SRR
geocodable_query: Tunisian and Libyan SRR, 30 NM from Libyan shore, 25 NM from Tunisian shore, 120 NM from Lampedusa, 190 NM from Malta
uncertainty_note: The Office cannot determine whether, and to what extent, the alleged inaction by the Italian and Maltese authorities could have contributed to the reportedly delayed medical evacuation, resulting in violation of the right to life.
context_note: Frontex surveillance aircraft detected a migrant boat in the Tunisian and Libyan SRR. NGO Sea-Watch rescued 56 migrants. Five migrants initially required medical evacuation, but authorities allegedly delayed. One person was pronounced dead two hours after the initial request for medical evacuation. Four critically injured persons were later evacuated from the Maltese SRR by the Italian Coast Guard. Allegations against Frontex for not sharing information were made by Sea-Watch, but the Fundamental Rights Office found them groundless and Frontex actions in line with obligations.
evidence_quote: On 06/03/2024, Frontex surveillance aircraft detected a migrant boat in the Tunisian and Libyan search and rescue region (SRR). ... Two hours after the first urgent evacuation request one rescued person was pronounced dead. Other four people in critical condition were evacuated from the Maltese SRR in the evening of the same day by the Italian Coast Guard.

uncertainty_note: Specific location redacted, only border area (Bulgaria/Turkey) is known.
context_note: An IRQ migrant claimed that Bulgarian police arrested him and other migrants, took their belongings (phones, jewels, sunglasses), and returned them to Turkey through a border fence. A police officer fired a shot in the air. The migrant expressed willingness to report officially.
evidence_quote: BGR police allegedly returned migrants to TUR

location_details: Location of the incident: Athens Airport. Reference to the operational area: No.
context_note: Two passengers from Istanbul to Athens were taken to a second line check at Athens Airport. A witness heard shouting and slapping noises from the searching room where Greek police officers were interrogating a third-country citizen.
evidence_quote: what I heard was shouting and noise of slapping/hitting. I don't know what really happened in the room but I heard noises.

location_details: The incident involved an interception by the Hellenic Coast Guard (HCG) near Northeast Samos within Greek territorial waters, followed by the migrants drifting into Turkish territorial waters where they were rescued by the Turkish Coast Guard (TCG) off the coast of İzmir's Menderes district.
where_clear: Sea area between Samos Island (Greece) and İzmir's Menderes district (Turkey).
location_text_raw: at sea north of Samos, inside Greek territorial waters near Samos, near Northeast Samos within Greek territorial waters, off the coast of İzmir's Menderes district, inside Turkish territorial waters
geocodable_query: Aegean Sea between Samos Island, Greece and Izmir Menderes, Turkey
uncertainty_note: The Office could not establish with certainty the exact location of HCG's intervention but believes it took place in Greek territorial waters. The exact route or distance taken by the migrant boat between interception in Greece and sighting in Turkish territorial waters is unknown.
context_note: A group of 14 irregular migrants on a rubber boat was intercepted by the Hellenic Coast Guard (HCG) near Samos, Greece. The HCG crew removed the boat's gasoline and left the migrants adrift. The same group was later rescued by the Turkish Coast Guard (TCG) from Turkish territorial waters. The incident put the migrants' lives at risk due to abandonment at sea with a partly functional engine.
evidence_quote: The measures the group of migrants was subjected to, and their abandonment at sea by the Hellenic Coast Guard have led to the migrants drifting with partly functional engine, for an extended period of time, putting their lives at risk.

location_details: Border police station in Sredets, Bulgaria, specifically a poorly maintained garage/shed on its premises, located approximately 40 kilometres from the Turkish border.
context_note: Media reports alleged inhuman detention conditions in a 'cage-like structure' at BCU Sredets, Bulgaria, and forced returns to Türkiye. Frontex presence was noted. FRO found people were held in the structure, likely amounting to inhuman/degrading treatment and breach of liberty rights. Frontex staff were not aware of the structure's use for detention.
evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office finds that the treatment of migrants in detention as evidenced by the media reporting very likely amounted to inhuman and degrading treatment and was in breach of the principle of human dignity.

location_details: Border police station in Sredets, Bulgaria. Migrants were detained in inhuman conditions in a 'cage-like structure' and forcibly returned to Türkiye.
location_text_raw: Bulgarian border police detained migrants in inhuman conditions on multiple occasions on the premises of a border police station in Sredets. Visual evidence obtained and published by the news outlets showed people locked in a poorly maintained garage described as a 'cage-like structure'.
context_note: Reporting by news outlets on 8 December 2022 alleged that Bulgarian border police detained migrants in inhuman conditions in a 'cage-like structure' at Sredets border police station. Migrants were also forcibly returned to Türkiye without asylum opportunity. The FRO considers it established that detention amounted to inhuman and degrading treatment.
evidence_quote: A joint reporting by several European news outlets published on 8 December 2022 alleged that the Bulgarian border police detained migrants in inhuman conditions on multiple occasions on the premises of a border police station in Sredets. Visual evidence obtained and published by the news outlets showed people locked in a poorly maintained garage described as a 'cage-like structure'.

location_details: The incident occurred close to the Bulgarian border fence in Türkiye, near 'concrete pyramid Nr 92' and Belevren. The migrant was injured on Turkish territory.
where_clear: Near border pyramid 92, close to Belevren, on the Bulgarian-Turkish border, on Turkish territory.
location_text_raw: close to the Bulgarian border fence in Türkiye, concrete pyramid Nr 92, close to Belevren, Turkish territory
context_note: A media report alleged that live ammunition was used against a migrant on 3 October 2022 near the Bulgarian border fence in Türkiye. The migrant claimed he was shot by Bulgarian border police after his group was pushed back, following an argument over alleged 'sexual' searches of women. Mobile phone footage showed migrants throwing stones. The migrant stated Bulgarian officers fired shots, with one hitting him in the hand and chest. Bulgarian authorities denied firing shots from their side, stating the group was aggressive, threw stones, injured an officer, and damaged a vehicle. The Fundamental Rights Office considers it credible that shots were fired and a migrant was injured, but could not conclusively establish who was responsible.
evidence_quote: While the Fundamental Rights Office considers it credible that shots were fired and a migrant was injured as a result, it could not conclusively establish who was responsible for the incident.

location_details: Bulgaria to Türkiye border, involving violence.
context_note: Allegations of fundamental rights violations related to pushbacks from Bulgaria to Türkiye, with explicit reference to violence.
evidence_quote: 5 cases contained explicit reference to violence (12819/2022, 14128/2022, 15549/2022, 11324/2023)

location_details: Near Lesvos Island, Greece, in Greek territorial waters, close to a rocky shore, approximately 100 meters to 1 kilometer from land. Migrants were later found drifting in Turkish territorial waters.
location_text_raw: near Lesvos on the morning of 13 November 2023
country_or_area: Lesvos Island, Greece / Turkish territorial waters
uncertainty_note: Exact coordinates not provided, distances to shore are estimates.
context_note: NGO reported Hellenic Coast Guard (HCG) immobilized a rubber boat with 23 migrants near Lesvos, allegedly destroying its engine with an iron tip and injuring some. Migrants were later rescued by the Turkish Coast Guard (TCG) in Turkish waters. The Fundamental Rights Office (FRO) concluded a likely collective expulsion by HCG, and possible violence and theft. Greek authorities denied involvement and failed to report the incident.
evidence_quote: the Office considers established that the group of migrants moved from Greek to Turkish territory and further, finds likely that this occurred as consequence of a collective expulsion executed by the Hellenic Coast Guard.

context_note: Warning shots were fired during the apprehension of irregular migrants transported by a facilitator in Bulgaria. A group of persons was detected, and during interception, the facilitator managed to escape but was later found in the forest. No one was injured.
evidence_quote: Warning shots fired during the apprehension of irregular migrants transported by a facilitator. No one was injured.

location_details: Registration activities at a Reception Center in the context of Joint Operation Ledra 2023.
where_clear: Reception Center, Joint Operation Ledra, Cyprus
location_text_raw: registration activities performed by Frontex in Joint Operation (JO) Ledra 2023
uncertainty_note: Specific name of the reception center is redacted.
context_note: Two incidents reported where a Frontex officer allegedly forced female migrants to remove their hijab during facial image taking for registration. In the second incident, a threat of return to country of origin was also alleged. The officer denied direct threats but admitted to using imprecise language. Lack of training and interpreter availability were identified as contributing factors. Cypriot authorities confirmed retaking a photo for one incident where the migrant's hijab was removed.
evidence_quote: a Frontex officer forced a female to remove her hijab

location_details: The incident occurred at the Serbian-Bulgarian border. Migrants crossed from Bulgaria to Serbia, were apprehended near the border by Serbian police, subjected to alleged ill-treatment, and forced to cross a river back into Bulgaria. The specific location of apprehension is redacted.
where_clear: Serbian-Bulgarian border, involving a river crossing
uncertainty_note: Specific location details are redacted in the document.
context_note: A group of seven migrants crossed from Bulgaria to Serbia. They were apprehended by Serbian police, allegedly subjected to ill-treatment (forced removal of clothes, physical violence including kicking and beating with stick/baton, punching) and collective expulsion back into Bulgaria by forcing them to cross a river. Photographic evidence of injuries (bruises and inflamed sores on feet) was provided by one migrant. Serbian authorities deny the allegations.
evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office considers likely that a group of seven migrants was apprehended by the Serbian police officers in Serbia, transferred by police car to the riverbank, and subsequently forced to cross the border into Bulgaria. The Office was unable to independently corroborate the alleged ill-treatment but considers it possible, that the group was subjected to ill-treatment before their collective expulsion.

location_details: Seven migrants crossed irregularly from Bulgaria to Serbia on 27/11/2023. On 01/12/2023, they were apprehended near [REDACTED] by Serbian police, who took them back to the border with Bulgaria, forced them to remove their clothes, physically mistreated them (kicking and beating with stick/baton), and ordered them to cross a river into Bulgaria.
where_clear: Serbia-Bulgaria border area, near a river
location_text_raw: apprehended near [REDACTED] by the Serbian police
uncertainty_note: Specific location on the border is redacted.
context_note: The Office takes note of the denial of any wrongdoing but underlines the need for an independent investigation into the matter.
evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office considers likely that a group of seven migrants was apprehended by the Serbian police officers in Serbia, transferred by police car to the riverbank, and subsequently forced to cross the border into Bulgaria.

location_details: The incident occurred within Serbian territory, near the border with Bulgaria. Migrants crossed from Bulgaria to Serbia on 25/11/2023, walking in a mountainous area with a train track, small guardhouse, and electric border cables. The encounter with Serbian authorities took place near a bridge, river, village, highway, and parking lot. The group was later transferred to a collection point via police car and military truck, and finally to another location close to a river for expulsion back to Bulgaria.
where_clear: Serbia-Bulgaria border area, within Serbian territory, near a bridge, river, village, highway, and train track.
location_text_raw: crossed irregularly from Bulgaria to Serbia
geocodable_query: Serbia Bulgaria border area, near bridge, river, village, highway, train track
uncertainty_note: The exact incident date varies in statements (27/11/2023 or 28/11/2023 for apprehension/return). Bulgarian authorities reported a detention of a group of 7 on 26/11/2023, which could be related but is not the core incident of this SIR. Serbian authorities deny any record of the incident.
context_note: Five migrants, part of a group of seven, were apprehended by Serbian police after crossing from Bulgaria into Serbia. They reported being physically mistreated on three occasions with kicks, sticks, batons, and tasers, having personal belongings confiscated, and then being forcibly returned to Bulgaria by being thrown into a river. One migrant sustained a wrist injury requiring a cast, and others had bruises. Serbian authorities deny the incident, citing no records, but the Fundamental Rights Office finds the migrants' statements generally credible and consistent, concluding the incident is 'possible'.
evidence_quote: the Fundamental Rights Office concludes as possoble that a group of five persons was apprehended in Serbia by the Serbian police, and subsequently ill-treated, had personal belongings removed and finally was collectively expelled to Bulgaria.

location_details: A group of seven migrants crossed irregularly from Bulgaria to Serbia on 25/11/2023. On 27/11/2023, they encountered Serbian authorities near a bridge, river, village, highway, and parking lot. They were physically mistreated, had personal belongings confiscated, and were forced to board a police car, then a military truck, and finally thrown into a river to cross back to Bulgaria. The migrants later surrendered to Bulgarian police on 28/11/2023.
where_clear: Serbia-Bulgaria border area, near a bridge and river
location_text_raw: crossed to Serbia on foot on 25/11/2023
context_note: This incident was enquired against the backdrop of a total 25 independent allegations of violent collective expulsions by the Serbian authorities that were reported to the Office since December 2023 which raise important concerns about the possibility of a respective practice of migrants' rights being violated at Serbia's border with Bulgaria.
evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office, even though it is not in position to independently establish with certainty the accuracy of the allegations, considers possible that the group was apprehended by the Serbian police, and subsequently ill-treated and collectively expelled to Bulgaria.

location_details: A group of individuals was detected less than 1.5 kilometers from the Serbian border, near the Serbian-Bulgarian border. They reported being beaten by Serbian police.
location_text_raw: less than 1,5 kilometer from the Serbian border
context_note: The Fundamental Rights Office concludes it is likely that a group of four individuals was apprehended in Serbia by Serbian police, ill-treated, and had their money taken. It is further considered possible that the group was collectively expelled to Bulgaria.
evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office concludes as likely that a group of four individuals was apprehended in Serbia by the Serbian police, and subsequently ill-treated and had their money taken.

location_details: The migrant alleged four instances of attempted irregular entry to Greece from Türkiye in the summer 2023, specifically in the Evros region around Soufli. Incidents involved crossing the Evros river, apprehension near Soufli, detention in facilities (one described as near a highway and football field, possibly BCU Soufli or Isaakio detention center), and subsequent pushbacks to Türkiye. The migrant mentioned crossing from the Ipsala area in Türkiye.
where_clear: Evros region, near Soufli, Greece/Türkiye border
location_text_raw: Evros region around Soufli, river Evros from Türkiye (near Soufli), Ipsala area, BCU Soufli, Isaakio detention center
uncertainty_note: The Fundamental Rights Office could not precisely geolocate the places of the incidents, but descriptions generally match the geography of the Greek territory in the Evros region near Soufli and the border with Türkiye.
context_note: A migrant reported four instances of attempted irregular entry and subsequent pushbacks from Greece to Türkiye in the Evros region during summer 2023. These incidents allegedly involved apprehension by Hellenic Police and masked individuals, detention, and forced return across the Evros river. The Fundamental Rights Office found the testimony credible but could not independently verify specific allegations due to lack of evidence.
evidence_quote: The Fundamental Rights Office finds the migrant's testimony to be credible, given its coherence, detailed nature, and consistency with documented patterns of alleged collective expulsion of migrants in the Evros region.

location_details: Group of 37 Syrian refugees on islets of the Evros river. Geographical coordinates provided via Google Maps link (https://goo.gl/maps/RdqLVY1hVWzmoPbD7).
uncertainty_note: Exact coordinates for this group are provided via a Google Maps link which cannot be accessed.
context_note: The National Commission for Human Rights (NCHR) was informed about a group of 37 Syrian refugees on Evros river islets. The group includes 16 minor children, at least 1 with a serious health problem, 2 infants, and one pregnant woman, all without access to food and water. Intervention was requested from police authorities starting 13/04/2022. The European Court of Human Rights (ECtHR) issued interim measures on 19/04/2022, instructing Greek authorities not to remove the refugees and to provide aid until 03/05/2022.
evidence_quote: Από την Τρίτη 20.04.2022 η ΕΕΔΑ ενημερώθηκε για την παρουσία 2 ομάδων 37 και 46 Σύρων προσφύγων σε νησίδες του ποταμού Έβρου. Στην ομάδα των 37 προσφύγων, σύμφωνα με τις πληροφορίες, βρίσκονται 16 ανήλικα παιδιά και τουλάχιστον 1 με σοβαρό πρόβλημα υγείας, καθώς και 2 βρέφη και μία έγκυος γυναίκα, χωρίς πρόσβαση σε τροφή και νερό. ... Ταυτόχρονα, παρείχε και το γεωγραφικό στίγμα για την διευκόλυνση των αρχών στον εντοπισμό της ομάδας των 37 προσφύγων (https://goo.gl/maps/RdqLVY1hVWzmoPbD7)...

location_details: Group of 46 Syrian refugees on islets of the Evros river, at coordinates 41.327094, 26.509524.

The group includes 9 minor children and several sick people, all without access to food and water. Intervention was requested from police authorities starting 18/04/2022. evidence_quote: Στην ομάδα δε των 46 προσφύγων, σύμφωνα με τις πληροφορίες, βρίσκονται 9 ανήλικα παιδιά και αρκετοί ασθενείς, χωρίς πρόσβαση σε τροφή και νερό. ... καθώς και τις συντεταγμένες για τη διευκόλυνση του εντοπισμού της ομάδας των 46 προσφύγων (41.327094,26.509524).

context_note: A Frontex officer (TM) at BCP Evzoni allegedly became aggressive, insulted a traveler, used offensive gestures, physically assaulted another passenger, slammed a car door, kicked a car, and caused physical and verbal violence to the traveler's wife. The officer admitted being pushed to his limits due to stress, overcrowding, and high temperatures. Measures included repatriation, disciplinary investigations, provisional suspension, and a recommendation for stress management training or psychological debriefing. The SIR case is closed from Frontex's perspective.

The incident started with a traveller asking a border guard (whom he identified as Text Removed - Justification 1 officer) with a Frontex armband who he was, after the border guard allowed a line of cars to pass ahead of the traveller. The border guard did not answer the question. He became aggressive and started insulting the traveller verbally and using offensive gestures.

location_details: Incident occurred on the bank of the Evros River, within the Evros Operational Area, near the Police Station of Ferres and LCC Evors.
where_clear: Evros River bank near Ferres, Evros Operational Area, Greece
location_text_raw: Police Station of Ferres, LCC Evors, Evros Operational Area, bank of Evros River
context_note: Two bodies found on Evros Operational Area. On the 08.12.2019 at 11:00 HP Officers, who were patrolling the area, detected two dead bodies (female) age between 15-25 on the bank of Evros River. No travel document were found. Dead bodies have been transferred to Alexandroupolis hospital. The autopsies have been requested by Hellenic Police in order to identify the reason of their death. The result of autopsies will be available in the follow-up SIR.
evidence_quote: Two dead bodies (female) age between 15-25 found on the bank of Evros River.
